tourName: 8 day great migration safari in Tanzania
generalInfo:
This is the ultimate journey: from the deep rumble of elephants in a lush paradise, across plains teeming with life’s relentless pulse, to the quiet strength of the Elephant cow heard in a sunken garden, and finally, into the hopeful embrace of a child’s smile. It is an expedition that changes you, leaving the dust of the plains on your boots and the indelible mark of Africa on your soul.

Then, you step onto the rim of Ngorongoro Crater and gaze into a lost world. This sunken Eden cradles the highest concentration of mammals on Earth. But here, one creature stands as a quiet symbol of resilience: the black rhinoceros. Spotting its prehistoric silhouette is a rare and poignant privilege, a direct encounter with a species fiercely guarded by dedicated rangers against immense odds. Witnessing this ancient survivor is a humbling reminder of our shared duty to protect the fragile threads of existence

Serengeti is not merely a plain; it is a living, breathing stage for the planet’s most profound drama of congregation. During the Great Migration, the horizon itself seems to move, pulsating with the sheer density of life. Over a million wildebeest, a relentless, grunting river of brown, flow alongside hundreds of thousands of striped zebra, their patterns creating a dizzying mosaic of movement. This staggering population is a raw, unfiltered spectacle of survival, of predator and prey playing out an ancient dance on grasslands that stretch to the very edge of the world.

dayInfo.description: Arrival at the Kilimanjaro International airport, Picked from the airport by your Safari Driver Guide drive to Arusha for accommodation for a 1 night. 1-hour drive from the Airport to Tumbili lodge in Arusha, a silent retreat deserved after a long flight. Overnight – Tumbili lodge(Bed & Breakfast Basis)

After your leisurely breakfast our office representative and your safari guide will give a short orientation of the Safari. Later start your lovely Journey from Arusha to Tarangire National Park with packed lunch for your first day wildlife adventure. It takes about 2-2.5-hour drive to Tarangire Park. The park is amazing for sighting of variable wildlife species also hosts amazing diversity of bird species, with no doubt Elephant paradise for its amazing Elephant population density. Lunch in the park when you build up an appetite, after lunch carries on with a game drive across variable areas for a couple of hours. Dinner & overnight – Tarangire Safari lodge (Full board Basis)

Another day in wildlife paradise Start your day the first thing in the morning after an early breakfast, to explore wildlife in the morning light of Africa sunrise with packed lunch. The Wild animals enjoy morning and evenings due to cooler temperatures. Lunch in the park when you build up an appetite after lunch explore the amazing wilderness across variable parts to maximize chances of seeing more and fascinating wildlife sights. Tarangire Park covers 2600 square kilometers and has the denser population of Elephants in the Northern tourist circuit of the Country. Dinner & overnight – Tarangire Safari lodge (Full board Basis)

After your leisurely breakfast, depart with packed lunch to the Serengeti national park.Along the way will have an excursion at the Mto-wa -mbu village for an hour walk across the village to see the real villager’s life and learn of the local ways of life.After the village walk carries on with the drive to the Serengeti.In between the Ngorongoro and the Serengeti there is a great museum where discoveries of the fossilized skull of the said Man ancestor were found. Visiting the Gorge is an optional activity that charges for a Gorge visit not included in the trip package, in fact the charges are 35.40 for adults and 11.80 for Children below 17. The wildebeest makes the most of the migration as they are around 1.3 million in population density in the Serengeti ecosystem, Zebras, & Variable kinds of Antelopes migrate as well. Why do they migrate? – Searching of favorable conditions of water and pasture. Lunch, when you build up an appetite after lunch, carries on with the game drive on the way to Southern Serengeti Dinner & Overnight – Ndutu lodge (Full Board Basis)

An early start with a packed breakfast, enjoy a morning drive with the greatest light for photography. Wild animals are good at energy conservation and tend to avoid activities in hot part of the day, instead they are active at dusk and dawn. Breakfast when you build up an appetite in the bush, after breakfast carries on with the game drive across the wilderness watching the great migration as well as any other interesting sight while on the drive. Lunch at the lodge, leave again for a game drive late afternoon when the sun cools down. In the evening enjoy few hours of game drive and cocktail in the bush while watching the sunset over the Serengeti. Dinner & overnight – Ndutu lodge (Full Board Basis)

An early start after breakfast, enjoy the Morning drive across the woodland and the savanna on the way to the Ngorongoro. Besides the great migration, there are smaller creatures like Dung beetles that utilize final products of the grazing animals for food and nesting site for their eggs, a combination of different creatures in an ecosystem enriches the ecosystem by maintaining its beauty and nature balance. Lunch in the bush when you build up an appetite, after lunch carries on to the lodge. Dinner & overnight – Lion’s paw (Full board Basis)

An early departure with packed breakfast. The caldera has a record of being largest unbroken walls (intact walls), and un-flooded. Wildlife diversity is amazing, literally among the few places in the world that yet has black rhinoceros conserved. Best time to see black rhino is the rainy season because pasture is good, a thing that attracts them to wonder widely than in the dry season. Breakfast in the crater when you build up an appetite. After breakfast enjoy few hours of game driving on the crater floor, before heading back to the lodge for lunch. After lunch have a pleasant stay at the lodge, explore the scenic landscapes and abundant bird life. Dinner & overnight

After your leisurely breakfast drive back to Arusha, it is 3.5 – 4-hour drive to Arusha ¾ of the road is paved. Lunch and day rooms in Arusha Tumbili lodge. Late evening around 17:00 hour live Tumbili lodge to Kilimanjaro International airport, 1 hour drive.

tourName: Best of Tanzania tailor made holiday
generalInfo:
Tanzania remains one of the most beloved and enchanting safari destinations in the world, and we've compiled the perfect tour to experience Tanzania's magnificence. Far more than just a place to see the Big Five and the Wildebeest Migration, Tanzania offers a wealth of natural and cultural experiences to be treasured for a lifetime.

Visit the surrounding communities, the iconic colorful attire and jumping dance of the Maasai have become synonymous with Africa, and it is in Tanzania and neighboring Kenya that these semi-nomadic people can be interacted with.

Also visit the Ngorongoro Crater and discover Ngorongoro Conservation area. Initially incorporated into the Serengeti National Park, the Area is not a National Park. It was founded in 1959, following a conflict between the National Parks and the Maasai, as a nature reserve to protect a unique wildlife but also as a haven for the Maasai. The towering walls of this massive volcanic caldera conceal a primal lost world in which many of Africa's most recognizable animals can be seen in their natural habitat.

The best place in Tanzania to see the endangered black rhinoceros, Ngorongoro crater floor is alive with animal life including lions, hyenas, flamingos, elephants, buffalo, warthogs, and hippos.

dayInfo.description: Kilimanjaro Airport - Arusha. Meet and greet at Kilimanjaro Airport. Our customer care representative will be waiting for you in the arrival hall carrying a branded sign board and assist you with your transfer to your hotel/lodge. Transfer from Kilimanjaro Airport to Arusha. Overnight at Arusha. Meals Breakfast

Ngorongoro Crater - Drive from Arusha to Ngorongoro. The road leads west, then south-west, skirting around the Monduli Mountains before crossing the eastern branch of the Great Rift Valley to the north of Lake Manyara. The road then climbs over the western ridge of the Rift Valley and ascends to the elevated Ngorongoro region. Approximate journey time 4 hours, depending on the exact start and end points. Route details and journey times may vary depending on road conditions. Discover the Ngorongoro Conservation Area. Initially incorporated into the Serengeti National Park, the Area is not a National Park. It was founded in 1959, following a conflict between the National Parks and the Maasai, as a nature reserve to protect a unique wildlife but also as a haven for the Maasai. Its name comes from the warriors of the tribe once living in the crater: the Likorongoros (which was distorted to Ngorongoro by the German colonists). The Ngorongoro Conservation Area covers approximately 8288 km2, 890 km2 of which is montane forest covering part of the crater wall. Ngorongoro offers a wide range of habitats: wetlands, grasslands, forests, streams and savannas ... The crater itself covers about 260 km2. A World Heritage Site, it is in fact a caldera, caused by the collapse of a massive volcano nearly 2.5 million years ago. During the descent into the crater you will enjoy a spectacularly panoramic view of the interior of the crater. Even from the top of the crater wall you'll notice the first large herds as dark spots on the landscape. The crater boasts the largest animal density in Africa with some 20 000 animals including around 55 species of mammals, ostriches, Kori bustards, dwarf flamingos, crowned cranes, zebras, gazelles, warthogs, wildebeest, hartebeest ... all are present. Eland, jackal, black rhino and some servals are also among the principal inhabitants. The Ngorongoro Crater is further home to many predators such as hyenas, lions and leopards. Cheetahs, giraffes, hartebeest and impala, however are missing. Visit a Masai Village in the Ngorongoro Conservation Area. The Masai arrived in this region approximately 200 years ago and today there are over 42 000 tribal people living in Ngorongoro alongside their cattle, donkeys, goats and sheep. They have the right to roam freely through the area and during the rainy season they move to the open plains while in the dry season they set up their homesteads in the adjacent bushland and mountain slopes. The Masai continue to follow a traditional way of life that includes living in harmony with nature and animals and their livestock can sometimes be seen grazing alongside wildlife on the open plains. Their homesteads are arranged in bomas, where huts are clustered in a circular shape and surrounded by thorn tree branches for protection, and during your visit you can learn more about their culture and lifestyle. Overnight at Ngorongoro. Meals Full Board

Ngorongoro Crater - Serengeti National Park- Set off on a 4x4 morning game drive as the sun sparkles on the lush plains of the Ngorongoro Conservation Area. This pristine and protected region is simply stunning in the morning as the freshness of a new day brings life to the Ngorongoro Crater, and the immense plethora of animals that take shelter there begin to stir and graze. Within the crater itself there are over 25 000 large animal species and herbivores such as zebra, eland and Grant’s and Thompson’s gazelle can be found in huge herds. The area is also rife with buffalo while elephant and reedbuck roam higher up near the rim of the crater. Bird varieties are extensive and your guide will point out the many varieties that you will come across during your morning game drive while white pelican and greater and lesser flamingo can be admired on Lake Magadi within the crater. Drive from Ngorongoro to the Serengeti. The road leads north-west. Leaving behind the fertile highlands area with its coffee and tea plantations it passes into the open planes of the Serengeti where Masai pastoralists co-exist with the African wildlife. Approximate journey time 3 to 5 hours, depending on the exact start and end points. Route details and journey times may vary depending on road conditions. Discover the Serengeti National Park. Created in 1951, the Serengeti (from Siringet, meaning "endless plain" in maa, the language of the Maasai) is one of the largest parks in Africa. Covering an area of 14,800 km2, it abuts the Ngorongoro to the east and the Masai Mara (Kenya) to the north. This is a magical place both for the beauty and diversity of the landscapes (plains, acacia savannah, hills, large forested areas) and for the variety of animals. The Serengeti National Park is home to a considerable wildlife population in all seasons: gazelles, antelopes, giraffes, buffalos, zebras, jackals, warthogs, monkeys ... all are gathered here. Elephants, hippos, crocodiles are also among the main residents of the park. Over 500 species of birds have been identified including ostriches, bustards and secretary birds. The park is also famous for its many predators: more than a thousand lions, hundreds of cheetahs, many hyenas and some leopards have been recorded. If the lions are more visible near the rivers (especially near the Seronera River), cheetahs and hyenas are more at home in the plains. Unleash your wild side on an afternoon 4x4 safari in the Seronera region of the Serengeti National Park. This area of the Serengeti offers a fantastic abundance of game viewing where it is not difficult to find all of the Big Five on one game drive and waterholes attract animals like magnets. Lion, giraffe and antelope roam freely across the open savannahs, while rhino stay close to the safety of the forest bush, and leopard and cheetah can be caught napping in the branches of acacia trees. As your game drive moves into the early hours of the evening, these predators begin to stalk the plains and large mammals such as buffalo take shelter in riverine vegetation. Fulfil your African safari dreams on the plains of the immense Serengeti while watching vultures feast off carcass remains and beautiful crowned cranes moving regally through the grasslands. Overnight at Serengeti Meals Full Board

Serengeti National Park- Morning safari in the Serengeti National Park. Covered with uninterrupted columns of zebra and gnu during the May migration, the savanna is the permanent home of the spotted hyena and the jackals, which would probably be the first animals you would meet. The spotted hyenas have the habit of digging their territory along the sides of the pathways and the jackals occupy the holes left vacant by the just as powerful vultures. Unleash your wild side on an afternoon 4x4 safari in the Seronera region of the Serengeti National Park. This area of the Serengeti offers a fantastic abundance of game viewing where it is not difficult to find all of the Big Five on one game drive and waterholes attract animals like magnets. Lion, giraffe and antelope roam freely across the open savannahs, while rhino stay close to the safety of the forest bush, and leopard and cheetah can be caught napping in the branches of acacia trees. As your game drive moves into the early hours of the evening, these predators begin to stalk the plains and large mammals such as buffalo take shelter in riverine vegetation. Fulfil your African safari dreams on the plains of the immense Serengeti while watching vultures feast off carcass remains and beautiful crowned cranes moving regally through the grasslands. Overnight at Serengeti. Meals Full Board

Manyara Drive from the Serengeti to Manyara. The B144 is the main road running through the Serengeti and connecting it with Ngorongoro and Manyara to the south-east. Approximate journey time 5 hours, depending on the exact start and end points. Route details and journey times may vary depending on road conditions. Discover Lake Manyara National Park. Set between the cliffs of the Rift Valley and the alkaline lake of the same name, Lake Manyara National Park covers some 320 km2. Its name derives from the Maasai word "emanyara", the name of a plant growing all around the lake and used by the local people to protect their homesteads. Dominated by the Rift Valley escarpment, Lake Manyara National Park presents a diverse flora. Thus, whereas the north is dominated by dense tropical vegetation (giant mahogany, wild palms), vegetation in the south becomes sparser before giving way to grassland and swamps near the lake. Covering an area of about 50 km2, this lake is a favorite with flamingos and waders. Some 350 species of birds have been identified including thousands of Egyptian geese. The park also offers all kinds of wildlife: giraffes, buffalos, zebras, baboons, monkeys or elephants, all are present. If you are lucky you might even spot lions in the trees. Perched in the acacias to better see their prey, the park is famous for these tree climbing lions. Track down tree-climbing lions on an afternoon 4x4 safari in Lake Manyara National Park in your tour vehicle. Small, yet filled with splendour, this park is a delight to explore, consisting of 11 different ecosystems that support one of the highest biomass densities of large mammals in the world. Among them are Lake Manyara’s famous tree-climbing lions, and although you may see lions in trees in other parks, it is a real speciality in Manyara. It is believed that the lions developed this habit in order to avoid pesky biting flies, but whatever the reason it is a unique sight to behold as well as a likely one on your afternoon game drive as these late-night predators take to trees for an afternoon nap. Traverse through the savannahs, marshes and evergreen forests as you seek out elephant, hippo, giraffe, buffalo, zebra, wildebeest and so much more. Overnight at Manyara. Meals Full Board

Tarangire - Drive from Manyara to Tarangire. The road leads south-east then turn south-west, passing through the semi-arid savannah landscapes of the Great Rift Valley floor. Approximate journey time 1 hour, depending on the exact start and end points. Route details and journey times may vary depending on road conditions. Discover the Tarangire National Park. Old hunting grounds declared a National Park in 1970, Tarangire is the sixth largest park in the country. Its name comes from the Tarangire River, which runs through the park from south to north. Covering an area of 2600 km2, Tarangire has an amazing diversity of plants (sausage trees, acacias tortelli ) but is best known for the huge baobab trees dotting its rocky slopes. The park also offers a very diverse fauna. Many birds have been identified including lapwings, African hoopoe, kingfishers, ostriches, Kori bustards, secretary birds, vultures and marabou storks. The savannah of the Tarangire National Park is also home to many animals. Thus, although the park is best known for hosting one of the largest concentrations of African elephants, it also houses many other residents. Impala, waterbuck croissant, buffalo, hartebeest, Cape eland, kudu and hyraxes live there. Lions, leopards and cheetahs are also present but are harder to see because of the tall grass. Create magical wildlife memories on an afternoon 4x4safari in the Tarangire National Park. This diverse and splendid park is one of four on Tanzania’s popular northern safari circuit and promises memorable game viewing as it holds one of the largest concentrations of elephants in the world as well as great prides of lions. Amongst the densely packed elephant grass, large areas of mixed acacia woodlands and lovely ribbons of riverine forest you can expect to see a plethora of animals such as wildebeest, zebra, impala, giraffe and buffalo. Lion are common throughout Tarangire, as are leopard and spotted hyena while cheetah, black rhino and the unusual gerenuk and bat-eared oryx are more elusive. Relish the marvellous wonders of the wilderness as your afternoon safari continues into early evening and giant baobab trees are silhouetted against the setting sun, creating iconic images of Africa. Overnight at Tarangire. Meals Full Board

Tarangire - Get a fresh start on the day with a morning 4x4 game drive in the Tarangire National Park. This beautiful park covers 2 600 km² of undulating grasslands and swamps that stretch from the plains of the Maasai Steppe in the southeast to the lakes of the Great Rift Valley to the north and west. The north of the park is the most visited area where the perennial Tarangire River meanders across the landscape, while the south consists of a series of vast swamps that transform into verdant plains during the dry season. During your morning game drive, you can expect to see plenty of elephant and lion, the most renowned residents of the park, as well as in excess of 400 species of birds. Admire the rising sun shimmering across the grassy savannas and the dappled light that filters through the branches of epic baobab trees while large herds of buffalo and zebra graze peacefully on the plains. Create magical wildlife memories on an afternoon 4x4safari in the Tarangire National Park. This diverse and splendid park is one of four on Tanzania’s popular northern safari circuit and promises memorable game viewing as it holds one of the largest concentrations of elephants in the world as well as great prides of lions. Amongst the densely packed elephant grass, large areas of mixed acacia woodlands and lovely ribbons of riverine forest you can expect to see a plethora of animals such as wildebeest, zebra, impala, giraffe and buffalo. Lion are common throughout Tarangire, as are leopard and spotted hyena while cheetah, black rhino and the unusual gerenuk and bat-eared oryx are more elusive. Relish the marvellous wonders of the wilderness as your afternoon safari continues into early evening and giant baobab trees are silhouetted against the setting sun, creating iconic images of Africa. Overnight at Tarangire. Meals Full Board

Kilimanjaro Airport - Get a fresh start on the day with a morning 4x4 game drive in the Tarangire National Park. This beautiful park covers 2 600 km² of undulating grasslands and swamps that stretch from the plains of the Maasai Steppe in the southeast to the lakes of the Great Rift Valley to the north and west. The north of the park is the most visited area where the perennial Tarangire River meanders across the landscape, while the south consists of a series of vast swamps that transform into verdant plains during the dry season. During your morning game drive, you can expect to see plenty of elephant and lion, the most renowned residents of the park, as well as in excess of 400 species of birds. Admire the rising sun shimmering across the grassy savannahs and the dappled light that filters through the branches of epic baobab trees while large herds of buffalo and zebra graze peacefully on the plains. Drive from Tarangire to Arusha. The road leads north, turning east and rising gradually from an altitude of 1050m in Tarangire to 1400m in Arusha, on the southern slopes of Mount Meru. Approximate journey time 3 hours, depending on the exact start and end points. Route details and journey times may vary depending on road conditions. Transfer from Arusha to Kilimanjaro Airport

tourName: Dik Dik safari circuit in Tanzania, wildlife & culture
generalInfo:
This is our Dik Dik safari circuit.

Even with it being budgeted safari itinerary it still provides a wonderful look at Tanzania's three key wildlife areas and is a great introduction to this country.

On this safari route you will experience much wildlife, and during your time in the Ngorongoro Conservation area there are opportunities for cultural visits too. This is a unique, protected area in Tanzania where humans and wildlife share the same environment.

On your visit to Serengeti NP you will be able to visit a Maasai Boma family for the morning and participate in their daily life for a few hour as a cultural exchange.

dayInfo.description: Arriving at Kilimanjaro International Airport (JRO), then 1hr transfer to Arusha region and Overnight in Arusha at Katambuga lodge

After breakfast, 2hrs Drive with packed lunch to Tarangire National Park, then a full day in Tarangire National Park , then 1hr drive to Karatu district and overnight in Ngorongoro Farm House at Karatu district.
After breakfast, 1hr 30mnts drive to Ngorongoro Crater with packed lunch, then a full day gamedrive down the crater and overnight in Ngorongoro Farm House
After breakfast, 2hr30mnnts drive to Serengeti National Park with packed lunch, then Gamedrive en-route to Serengeti National Park and overnight in Katikati camp in Central Serengeti National Park
Early morning gamedrive with packed breakfast to the Eastern side of Serengeti, then a Lunch in Katikati camp, then an Evening gamedrive in Central Serengeti and a Sundowner at Central Serengeti

After breakfast, a drive to Seronera Airstrip, gamedrive en-route, then Fly to Arusha for a day room before your International flight home, followed by a day room at Katambuga Lodge and later transfer to Kilimanjaro International Airport ( JRO )

tourName: Exciting family holiday in Tanzania
placesVisited: Arusha, Tarangire National Park, Lake Manyara National Park, Ngorongoro Crater, Serengeti National Park, Zanzibar, Stone Town, Zanzibar Beach
generalInfo:
If there’s one thing to get children and parents raring to go it’s going to be an exciting family holiday in Tanzania and although there’s no age limit on this tailor made trip, older children, above 7 or 8yrs old, will certainly benefit the most. From the vast plains of the Serengeti to the unique environment of Ngorongoro Crater this experience will take you to some of Africa’s most concentrated areas for wildlife with stunning natural backdrops adding to the inspirational experiences for young and older travellers alike.

Watching lions on the prowl and elephants by the watering hole will become daily occurrences with ranger instructions enabling everyone to become skilled in the ways of safari and Tanzania's natural environment. From giraffes gorging on high branches to rhinos munching on low level shrubs, this trip will go some way to giving children first-hand experiences that they’ll no doubt cherish for the rest of their lives. As if the chance to spot leopards, zebra, buffalo and wildebeest in their natural environment wasn't enough, this two week tour rounds off on the stunning spice island of Zanzibar the home of white sand beaches and a mix of Arabian, African, Asian and European cultural influences.

A whole host of family-friendly accommodation and child-friendly facilities make this trip as relaxing and safe as possible with swimming pools, private verandas and community areas from where to socialise or stare wistfully at the night’s sky. Strict security at all camps and lodges featured within the itinerary ensures you can travel with confidence and enjoy every minute with a combination of electrified perimeters and well trained safari staff and patrol groups further ensuring a safe and secure experience. Further to the trained safari team all of the camps include strict safety instructions as to what is expected of safari guests and a full introductory meeting will explain the rules and regs as soon as you arrive.

dayInfo.description: ARUSHA Arrive in Arusha where you will be met by one of our representatives and transferred to your hotel.

TARANGIRE NATIONAL PARK Adventure calls as you take a road trip to Tarangire National Park. The park is cut through by the Tarangire River, which proves a magnet for all manner of wildlife during the long dry season when the surrounding area becomes particularly parched. Large herds roam the riverbed whilst zebra, buffalo, gazelle and wildebeest try to avoid the predatory advances of lion and leopard. Children will love becoming little explores as the spot 1 of 550 bird species in the Tarangire swamps.

LAKE MANYARA NATIONAL PARK Rise with the sun as you take a short drive to Lake Manyara National park, a natural beauty. The calm glass-like waters stretch for nearly 50km along the base of the Rift Valley escarpment, sprinkled with the coral pink of a thousand flamingos. The dense acacia forest is home to families of baboons and tree-climbing lions, for which the park is notorious. Spend the day exploring the park before continuing to your lodge.

NGORONGORO CRATER It’s an early start for explorers as you head to the Ngorongoro Crater. The ancient volcanic crater is home to an extraordinary concentration of wildlife including lions with burnt orange manes and spotted hyena. Adventures would be considered extremely unlucky if they left the Ngorongoro Crater having not spotted the big five. Lion, rhino, leopard, elephant and buffalo waiting in the wings, ready for their close-up! The views must not go unmentioned; from the first glimpse of the crater at ‘Heroes’ Point’, through the thick rain forest and down to the rich grassy plains there are countless photo opportunities with the family. The combination of natural scenery and wildlife is truly breath-taking. During the game drive you will stop for a delicious picnic on the crater floor, always a hit with hungry children.

SERENGETI NATIONAL PARK After filling your stomachs you will head for the Serengeti National Park. En route, why not stop off at the Olduvai Gorge. The steep sided ravine in the heart of the Great Rift Valley is famous for the variety of early hominid fossils that have been found here. Children will love popping into the on-site museum for an immersive and exciting experience.

SERENGETI NATIONAL PARK Enjoy two full days to explore the Serengeti with both morning and afternoon game drives. The Serengeti National Park is the jewel in the crown of Tanzania’s game parks and offers arguably the best game viewing in Africa. The setting is breathtaking; a sea of endless plains that stretch to the horizon is dotted with solitary acacia trees and termite mounds. The savannah is home to countless buffalo herds that migrate north on mass each year. Their journey does not come without its hazards as they make a splash in crocodile infested waters! Little explores will love spotting the abundant wildlife. Herds of eland, impala and gazelle avoid the prides of lion that rule the kingdom in this savannah, their hungry gaze and predatory strut makes them very distinctive among the dusty terrain. Solitary leopard stake out their place in the high branches of the acacia tree and herds of elephants roam at will. This is the Africa that you have always dreamed about.
SERENGETI NATIONAL PARK Your second day in the Serengeti.

SERENGETI – ZANZIBAR Enjoy a morning game drive before transferring to the Seronera airstrip for a flight to Zanzibar. On arrival you will transfer to your hotel in Stone Town where you can unwind after a mammoth adventure so far.

STONE TOWN Rise at your own pace as you spend the day exploring the wonderful labyrinthine streets of Stone Town. Most of the city was built in the 19th century when Zanzibar was a thriving trading community, a vital stop on the Spice Route where traders would stock up on warming cardamom, cinnamon and spicy pepper. You would not be blamed for getting lost in the beauty of this well preserved town. Hours slip by as you explore the narrow streets, following your nose into little alleyways flanked with crumbling colonial buildings, wrought iron balconies and thick wooden doors decorated with brass studs. Make sure to stop in the authentic cafes and sample the delicious cuisine.The city feels very exotic and children will be entranced! A tour of Stone Town is available on request.
STONE TOWN - ZANZIBAR BEACH Continue your tour of Africa as you transfer to Zanzibar beach. The rest of the day is free for you to unwind on the white sand beaches or swim in the crystal blue seas.
ZANZIBAR BEACH Enjoy two full days to watch the world go by from Zanzibar beach. For the adventurous, why not try a spot of snorkelling.
ZANZIBAR BEACH – AIRPORT Time to say goodbye to Africa as you return home.

tourName: Great migration photography holiday, Tanzania
generalInfo:
Tanzania is a theater of raw, unscripted drama for the wildlife photographer. It’s the tension before a river crossing, a million hooves churning dust into gold. It’s the intimate moment of elephants communing by a Tarangire river, their ancient eyes holding galaxies of wisdom. It’s the explosive chase on the Serengeti plains, where survival is measured in heartbeats. Within Ngorongoro’s crater walls, life is condensed into a breathtaking frame—predator and prey on a stage millions of years old. This is photography that captures the wild’s unyielding pulse, its brutal beauty, and its timeless soul.

Your journey begins where the giants walk. In Tarangire National Park, you don’t just see elephants—you are immersed in their world. This is home to the highest elephant population density in Tanzania, where monumental herds move with ancient, seismic grace through a landscape of surreal beauty. The air is filled with their deep, resonant rumbles and the dazzling chorus of over 550 species of amazing birdlife. All of this unfolds beneath the watchful gaze of ancient, colossal baobab trees, their silhouettes painting a scene of timeless, scenic grandeur against the vast African sky.

From the baobab-dotted plains, you ascend to the roof of the world and peer into Ngorongoro Crater. This is not a view; it’s a vision. The scenic majesty of this unbroken caldera, a self-contained Eden, takes your breath away. Within its walls thrives the world’s densest concentration of larger mammals, a breathtaking micro-kingdom. Here, your search turns to one of Earth’s rarest sights: the critically endangered black rhinoceros. Witnessing this prehistoric survivor is a testament to fierce, ongoing preservation, a profound encounter with conservation in action.

Then, the horizon expands infinitely. The Central Serengeti reveals itself as the vibrant microcosm of the entire Serengeti ecosystem. This is the stage for the eternal drama of predator and prey, where lion prides reign over rocky kopjes and cheetahs survey the golden grasses. It is the enduring, year-round heart of the wild.

Finally, the journey culminates in the Northern Serengeti. In the dry season, this rugged, remote land transforms into the ultimate great migration refuge. Witness the Mara River’s dramatic, churning crossings, where thunderous herds of wildebeest and zebra brave crocodile-infested waters in a desperate, thrilling push for survival. It is raw, unfiltered nature at its most powerful and poignant.

This curated safari is a passage through the definitive icons of Africa—from elephant kingdoms and sunken Edens to the eternal plains and the river of life itself. It is the greatest wildlife sequence on Earth, experienced in its full, majestic spectrum.

dayInfo.description: On arrival at Kilimanjaro International Airport after immigration formalities, meet your safari guide outside of the arrival lounge. Your destination on the first night is Arusha, 55 km away from Kilimanjaro International Airport (about 1 hour drive). Overnight at Kahawa house Dinner and breakfast provided.

Arusha—Tarangire National Park Your safari guide will have your packed lunch in a vehicle before you leave for Tarangire. The drive will take 2 – 2.5 hours. At the main gate to Tarangire National Park, while your guide pays Park fees, you can stretch your legs in the parking lot; this is a good time to use the restroom. Tarangire National Park covers 2600 square kilometers (1615 square miles). The diversity of flora and fauna is great year-round, though in the wet season some wildlife like wildebeest and zebra tend to wander widely to an extensive Maasai steppe south of the park. Lunch at the park when your appetite calls. After lunch, you will continue with the game drive for a couple of hours. Overnight—Tarangire Safari lodge Breakfast, lunch, and dinner provided & unlimited drinking water in the car.

Explore the beauty of Tarangire The bird and elephant populations at Tarangire are phenomenal. The park has over 500 bird species—a mecca for birders! Besides birding, the park has the largest elephant population density per square kilometer in the northern part of the country compared to other parks. The great wildlife diversity of the park makes it one of the great places that can be visited year-round, though many claim that Tarangire is its best in the dry season. At the camp, you’ll have a few hours for lunch and a rest before the late afternoon game drive. Another option could be having a packed breakfast and lunch instead of stopping at the camp for lunch; this would allow us to extend time in the park. Overnight— Tarangire Safari lodge Breakfast, lunch, and dinner provided & unlimited drinking water in the car.

Tarangire—Ngorongoro Enjoy the half day game drive in Tarangire before proceeding to Karatu via Mto wa Mbu village. Today you will visit Tarangire primary school for a school visit and then proceed to Mto wa Mbu village for cultural tourism. You can observe irrigation farming and wander the village on foot or bike and later enjoy the local food. After lunch you will be driven to Ngorongoro for dinner and overnight at the Angata tented camp Breakfast, lunch, and dinner provided & unlimited drinking water in the car.

Ngorongoro Crater You will take a packed breakfast for an early start to visit the famous Ngorongoro Crater. Today will be a long day. You will arrive at Ngorongoro Crater around 7 to start your game drive! Ngorongoro Conservation Area covers 8,292 square kilometres (5200 square miles). The crater was formed over 2.5 million years ago after violent volcanic activities. The volcano eventually collapsed to form a huge depression known as a crater, though technically it is a caldera due to the type of formation and the size of the area. Wildlife diversity is wonderful in the crater, and it is one of the very few places left in the world where the black rhinoceros thrive. We will break for lunch when you are ready. After lunch, we will continue with a game drive until 12 before driving out of the crater to get back to the camp. Sighting of rhinos in the dry season is quite challenging because their favourite pasture is dry and short; usually, the rainy season is the best time to see them as they wander more widely because of abundant food almost everywhere. Overnight – Angata tented camp Breakfast, lunch, and dinner provided & unlimited drinking water in the car

Moru, Seronera, & East Serengeti Enjoy the game drive according to your plan with your guide. Serengeti National Park is a huge park that covers 14,763 sq kilometers (9200 miles). The central core commonly known as Seronera is one of the great areas for big cats sighting; it’s never a guarantee, but chances are higher. Great migration moves into different parts of the park at different times of the year as the animal searches for water and pasture. From June to October, the Central Serengeti hosts the resident wildlife as the transition zone between the short grass plain of the Southern Serengeti and the woodland and long grassland of the Western Serengeti. It has adequate pasture and water from variable sources that sustain the population of the resident game. After lunch at the camp, you will leave again in the late afternoon when the sun cools for a couple of hours’ game drive. Overnight—Angata tented camp

An early departure again with packed breakfast, to explore the Serengeti. Each day in the wilderness gives a complete difference with the previous day’s experience. Wild animals are so interesting to watch and observe their behavior, our game plan goes across unbeaten tracks where you feel immersed in the heart of the wilderness. Sharing knowledge of flora and fauna makes safaris more interesting and entertaining. Breakfast when you build up an appetite. Each part of the Serengeti Ecosystem has variable areas for game drives one can stay for several days and yet feels genuine on each game drive. Lunch at the camp, then siesta and leave again by the late afternoon when the sun cools down. Evening drives are great as sometimes might be able to see nocturnal creatures, like caracal, Serval cat or porcupines, or even predator / prey activities. Dinner & Overnight - Angata tented camp

Central—Northern Serengeti Depart with packed lunch to the Northern Serengeti across the most remote parts of the park to maximize chances for wildlife sightings. The variable terrain and habitat of the Serengeti ecosystem provide potential habitat to an amazing variety and concentration of wildlife species. The rock outcroppings are not only scenic, but they also provide essential habitat for cats to hide their newborn at the early stage when they are prone to their natural enemies. Birds of different species can be observed and identified, including big birds of prey like the Martial eagle, Verraux eagle, dark and pale chanting goshawks, Verraux eagle owls; the area has a fascinating abundance of birdlife. You’ll enjoy lunch in the bush when you build up your appetite; after lunch carry on with the game on the way to the Northern Serengeti. Overnight –Mara mara tented lodge Breakfast, lunch, and dinner provided & unlimited drinking water in the car.

Northern Serengeti An early start after breakfast for a game drive with a packed lunch. Taking a packed lunch allows flexibility on the game drive, as you won’t need to adjust your time for the sake of getting to the camp for lunch. Sightings like the great migration crossing the flooded river require a lot of patience, as sometimes animals gather in massive herds over the river bank a few hours before crossing. Besides the great migration, the area has amazing wildlife diversity including big and small cats such as the lions, leopards, cheetahs, and even smaller cats like the caracal, African wild cats and the serval cats. Generally, small cats are more crepuscular in nature; they are more active in the twilight of dawn and dusk and are rarely seen in daylight hours. Your professional safari guide will pick a nice spot for lunch in the bush while enjoying the natural beauty of the Serengeti. After lunch carry on with the game drive for a couple of hours. Overnight – Mara mara tented lodge Breakfast, lunch, and dinner provided & unlimited drinking water in the car.

An early start again with packed breakfast for game drive in different areas in the Northern Serengeti. The rocky outcrops serves potential habitat for cats to give birth and hide their cubs, at times you might see Leopards or lions basking on the rocks. Besides the river crossing at the Mara River, the river has lots of crocodiles and hundreds if not thousands of Hippopotamuses as well. Breakfast at the bush when you build up an appetite. After breakfast continue with the game drive for few hours before lunch. There is always an opportunity to spot something in the wilderness. Lunch at the lodge, leave again when the sun cools down by the late afternoon for few hours’ games drive and enjoy some drinks in the middle of the Serengeti with the sun set. Dinner & overnight

After a final morning in the wild, you will transfer to Kogatende Airstrip for your scenic flight back to Arusha. This journey offers a stunning final perspective on the open plain you've explored before you connect with your flight home.

tourName: Great migration small group safari, Tanzania
generalInfo:
This great migration across Tanzania's Serengeti National Park is a spectacle of nature and an iconic safari option for avid travellers, nature lovers and those who want a little more from their African experience. In February the herd of 3 million Wildebeest give birth to 500,000 calves, which is in itself a wondrous event, but this attracts one of the highest densities of predators in Africa and the scene is set.

Before you arrive, our mobile camp will have moved to the right places close to the migration herds, enabling you to experience splendid isolation in total comfort. Daily game drives are blessed with a spectacular array of wildlife and the world's largest migration circuit, making the Serengeti is ultimate safari country.

dayInfo.description: This safari starts at Kilimanjaro airport where you will be met by our Tanzanian team and transfer to a Country House hotel near Arusha on a bed and breakfast basis. Set in the hills with lovely views, this boutique hotel has a fabulous restaurant and is the perfect place to rest and relax after a long flight.

After breakfast, we will depart for a game drive inside Tarangire National Park, well known for its gigantic baobab trees, tree climbing pythons and large elephant herds. Enjoy an extended game drive ending at Nyiakani Tarangire Camp.

Awake to the wild sounds of nature for breakfast and depart for a full day game vireiwng within the reserve with picnic lunch. The park runs along the line of the Tarangire river that attracts an abundance of wildlife, from elephant, lion, leopard, buffalo, zebra, giraffe, antelope and an amazing variety of birds. ending at Kirurumu Manyara Lodge for dinner and overnight.

After an early breakfast, transfer to Lake Manayra Airport for a small plane flight to South Serengeti airstrip. Meet your guide and game drive to the stunning exclusive Bush Rover Migration Camp. After lunch, head out for a game drive returning to the camp for sundowners and dinner.

Explore this game rich area of Serengeti and marvel at the greatest safari spectacle in the world. Tanzania is blessed with an incredible array of safari experiences, but the Serengeti, with its magnificent migrating herds and huge population of predators, is unbeatable. Return to the camp after your game drive, relax in the mess tent or from the balcony of your Bush Rover suite and take in the surroundings before heading to the camp fire for a sundowner before dinner prepared by your private chef.

Say goodbye to The Bush Rover Migration Camp and journey towards Lake Victoria, exploring the central area of the vast Serengeti. Arrive at the intimate Little Okavango Camp at last light. Dinner and overnight.

Awake at dawn for a quick cup of tea or coffee and head out by vehicle to Speke Bay named after John Hanning Speke, the first European to reach Lake Victoria in his search for the source of the Nile. Explore the coastline of this vast lake full of crocs, hippo and great birdlife right up to the fishing village of Mwaburugu- meet local boat builders from the Sukuma tribe and watch life on the lakeside with the men bringing in their catch. The tour lasts for 4 - 5 hours and gives a fascinating insight into life on the lake. Return by motor boat for a lovely brunch at the Little Okavango amazing tower. After lunch and a rest, enjoy a guided bird walk on camp's grounds or relax with a gentle canoe ride
Transfer to Mwanza Airport for a flight to Julius Nyerere Int Airport (DAR) where your safari ends.

tourName: Impala safari route in Tanzania
generalInfo:
This safari is unique way of collecting Africa stories, from people to wild lands.

After arriving from Home, you would drive to Arusha region to overnight. The next morning after breakfast, you would leave for Tarangire National park for about 2hrs drive.
A drive from Arusha to Tarangire its so unique , which will provide the chance to explore the uniqueness of this Habitat as it stretches from High lush lands of Mt Meru ( The second highest mountain in Tanzania) to the dry Acacia dominated woodland on the western side.
As the habitat change from forest to woodland then to open grassland there will be a lot of stories to tell which are quite unique.
Visiting Ngorongoro Crater as one of the Natural wonder in Africa, for its uniqueness some people refer it to be the Eden Garden. The unique goes over and the Oscar-winning movie OUT OF AFRICA was partly filmed here.
And Serengeti National Park is a home for lots of different kinds of Animal you find in Africa.
And above all, you will be able to visit different local tribes from all this protected areas.

dayInfo.description: Arriving in Kilimanjaro Airport and 1hr Drive to Arusha Region, then Overnight in Katambuga lodge
A 2hrs Drive to Tarangire National Park with packed lunch after Morning breakfast, then a full Day Gamedrive in Tarangire National Park and Overnight in Marera valley Lodge
After breakfast, 3hrs drive to Seronera in Central Serengeti National Park with a gamedrive enroute , then a picnic lunch in Central Serengeti and overnight in Katikati camp
After breakfast, A full Day Gamedrive in Central Serengeti with packed lunch and overnight in Katikati Camp

Early morning gamedrive in Eastern Serengeti with Hot lunch in Katikati camp, then Evening gamedrive in Central Serengeti and a Sundowner at the vast plains of Serengeti, thereafter overnight in Katikati camp
After Breakfast, A 2hr30 Drive to Arusha for a day room before your International Flight back home and later a 1hr Transfer to Kilimanjaro International Airport

tourName: Kaka Circuit safari in Tanzania
generalInfo:
We specialise in tailor made safaris for travellers of all types, including couples, friends and families. This is our new favourite Tanzania route, which can be customised specifically for you.

On this tour we will take you to Tanzania's incredible National Parks, miraculous places of which few remain now on Earth. When we take you to local places, and we mean local and not touristic. We are here to design a truly memorable experience for you.

Activities on this tour include game viewing, nature walks, hiking, birding and if you are interested, biking around villages on local routes, authentic cultural visits, night game drives and star gazing.

We are local operators who have spent a lot of time in our field, and we have first hand knowledge and experience to ensure we can provide the best for our guests. The health, happiness and safety of our customers is our priority.On your safari you will travel with the best possible professional guides, who are commended for their experience, friendly, enthusiastic and positive attitude, their knowledge and of course their sense of humour!

We are a conservation focused travel company, started by two proud conservationists with the belief of conserving these beautiful places and its people through responsible tourism. Imagine being on safari with us knowing you have contributed to the wonderful places and communities you are visiting, and supporting conservation efforts for the betterment of generations after us.

dayInfo.description: Arriving at Kilimanjaro International Airport, Received by our team members right outside your International Flight. Our team will help you to clear all airport papers including visa ,passport and help you with luggage. Driving for 45 minutes to Overnight in Arusha region.

Leaving after breakfast at 08h00 and spend a day doing game drives in Arusha National Park with packed lunch and will get the opportunity to do the walk for 1hr to 2hrs depend on guest discretion. The walk provides you with a beautiful scenery of Mt. MERU along side with water falls especially after a long day spent in the vehicle.

Leaving after breakfast at 08h00 and the whole day drive South of Arusha with packed lunch into Maasai Lands. The lunch set-up on the view will be done right in the wild between Maasai land. After lunch will be able to drive slowly in Tarangire National Park and stays for two nights in one of our favourite Camp. The main activities will be Game drives,Walkings, Night Game drives under African Starry Starry Night Sky.

Early morning game drive with packed breakfast and later coming back for an early lunch at the camp. After Lunch, a drive via Manyara National Park, this park is small but beautiful place for wild game, Authentic wild fragrance, scenery and birding towards Ngorongoro hills. On the slope of these hills will spend two nights. One night on the day of arrival and the other after spending the whole day in Ngorongoro Crater.

Drive down in Ngorongoro Crater with packed breakfast spend the day in the crater and coming back for late lunch back at the lodge. On this day if there is a local market will have the opportunity to go to this place which is one of the biggest local market happens once per every month but if not then will have go to the small local market, happens everyday to experience the cultural economics. For those who wish to go to spa, this is their day too, they are more than welcome. For this day we can set more activities for those who wish to do after a game drive from Ngorongoro crater.

After breakfast, leaving the camp and drive via Ngorongoro highlands with packed lunch to Eastern plains of Serengeti National Park for 3 nights. A game drive en-route. These vast plains are famous for cats and much of our time will spend doing game drives.

Packing everything after breakfast and drive through the Central Serengeti towards the Southern Serengeti with packed lunch. Spend the whole day out on game drive and arrive late afternoon to the camp for other two nights. The two nights will be spent doing game drives and walkings. If the opportunity rise, you might encounter Black Rhino which is potentially endangered compared to any other in Africa Rhino but this place also host some few packs of Africa Wild dogs which are also endangered.

Early morning at Sunrise Packing everything and Say goodbye to Serengeti, Ngorongoro, Manyara, Tarangire, Arusha National Park whether by road or take a flight from Ndutu Aistrip to Arusha and be ready for an evening Departure from Kilimanjaro International Airport which you landed on your Arrival. Our team will be there to assist, to provide you with special attention just like the way they did on your arrival date to make sure its a hassle-free way of your Safari. On this day will be Saying See you soon and not Goodbye.

tourName: Luxury Tanzania safari and Zanzibar beach holiday
placesVisited: Flight over Selous Game Reserve, Selous Game Reserve safaris, Luxury safari camp, Choose from game-drives, boat safaris, and walking safaris, Light aircraft flight to Zanzibar, Baraza Resort and Spa, Snorkelling
generalInfo:
This Tanzania safari and beach holiday is the perfect package of game watching and coastal paradise. After arriving in Dar es Salaam, you will take a light aircraft south to the Selous Game Reserve. Although the Selous doesn’t have the worldwide reputation of the Serengeti, it is even larger at 45,000 square kilometres with wonderful wildlife populations, yet far fewer visitors.

You will spend several days in the Selous, with three days of game viewing activities choosing between game drives, boat safaris and walking safaris. The reserve is home to elephant, buffalo and antelope, as well as lion, leopard, wild dog and zebra. Hippo, crocodile and a stunning array of birdlife call the waterways of the Selous home, and the lagoons are where you will get to see the skeletal leadwood trees poised beautifully. The photographic opportunities here are second to none.

You will be staying at a safari camp located on the Rufiji River. The rooms have traditional canvas siding but are set on raised platforms with thatched roofs. They are semi-permanent structures, with ensuite facilities and a shaded veranda looking out at the river. You can also opt for a deluxe tent, which have private plunge pools overlooking the river. There is a communal pool area for guests, also shaded, so a perfect place to rest in the heat of the midday sun.

Boutique hotel in Zanzibar

You will take a light aircraft flight out to the Tanzanian island of Zanzibar on day six of this itinerary, although as this is tailor made we can of course tweak it to suit your preferences. Zanzibar is an idyllic island in the Indian Ocean that boasts an eclectic mix of cultures as well as stunning beaches. Our choice of accommodation for your holiday is Breezes Beach Club, on the island’s southeast coast. This is one of the island’s best beaches.

The resort itself has been designed with great care and style, using a mix of Swahili, Arabic and Indian influences all of which claim heritage on the island. Breezes has a choice of bars and restaurants, a large swimming pool and a magnificient white sand beach with palm trees, the lapping sea and plenty of sunbeds. The rooms have all of the mod cons including air conditioning and ensuite facilities. Both accommodations on this holiday work closely with the community. Please see below in our responsible tourism statement for more details.

dayInfo.description: This evening you will take your overnight flight to Dar Es Salaam.

Arriving at the airport, your safari starts with a light aircraft flight into the heart of the Selous Game Reserve, just 45 minutes from Dar es Salaam. You get some great views of the Rufiji River and tall borassus palms as you fly in over the reserve. After settling into your camp, head out on a guided boat safari, gliding over the water as you watch out for hippo and crocodiles and admire the sunset. Tonight in camp you can enjoy a bush dinner by lamplight, and choose what you'd like to do tomorrow.

On your first full day of safari in Selous, whether you've chosen to do a bush walk, game drive or boat safari, you'll be in for some close wildlife encounters. You could see lion, elephant, wild dogs, zebra, wildebeest, giraffe, impala and eland, as well as the elusive leopard. Each game activity is led by an expert guide and with a small group of guests from the camp. Building a camaraderie with your fellow safari-goers, you can recall tales from your day's adventure while gathered around the campfire this evening.

During your stay we recommend taking a guided bush walk, accompanied by a ranger who'll share their knowledge and passion for the reserve's wildlife as well as ensuring your safety. Being on foot gives you a completely different perspective to being in a vehicle, allowing you to appreciate the smaller details, from the wonderful birdlife to paw prints in the dirt. You feel far more immersed in the landscape, and your proximity to the wildlife provides you with many stories to take home with you.

Enjoy another day of exploring the reserve. The Selous is one of the few places in Tanzania where you might see the incredibly rare wild dogs, otherwise known as the painted wolf. They've become a cult sighting for wildlife lovers, and the guides and trackers of the camp will give you the best possible chance of finding them.

You've a final chance to spot wildlife on the drive to the airstrip this morning, before catching a light aircraft flight to Zanzibar. After the hour-long flight you're met by your driver for a private transfer across the island to the beautiful palm-fringed east coast. The hour-long journey takes you through vibrant villages and past spice plantations on the way. You could spend the rest of today relaxing in your hotel's spa, lazing on the beach or cycling out to explore the local fishing villages of Bwejuu and Paje.

You can spend the day taking in your beautiful beachside surroundings, reading a book under the shade of a palm tree and swimming in the warm Indian Ocean. If you're feeling more active, you can easily arrange diving or snorkeling, try a spot of kite surfing or head out on a pedalo.

You could head into Stone Town for a day trip today. The historic town is located on the west coast, around an hour and a half from your hotel - we can arrange for a private transfer. The hub of the spice trade for centuries, Stone Town has an interesting past and you'll stumble across ornate carved doorways and market stalls as you walk around. We can arrange for a local guide to show you around and tell you about the town's history. There are also dozens of restaurants and food stalls lining the streets, making this the best place on the island to try the local cuisine, which combines Arab, Portuguese, Bantu, Indian and British influences, as well as using the spices grown on the island.

Your days at your own leisure. In your free time we suggest visiting one of the small-scale spice farms on the island - you get a really hands-on experience tasting and smelling the spices for which the island is famous, which include cinnamon, tumeric, nutmeg and vanilla. Alternatively, guided spice tours lead you through rural villages and Zanzibar's countryside as your guide picks leaves, fruits and twigs for you to smell or taste before guessing what spices they are. You could also explore another area of Zanzibar, the enchanting Jozani Forest in the south of the island. Within this tropical forest you can see the rare Kirk's red colobus monkeys, which are endemic to the island and really entertaining to watch leap and play in the trees. Several other monkey species can be found here, as well as a variety of birdlife. There is plenty to do around the island, but equally some of your days could be spent relaxing on the beach or at your hotel.
Today your private driver transfers you to Zanzibar Airport for your onward flights.

tourName: Luxury Tanzania safari & Lake Victoria
generalInfo:
Explore three of Tanzania’s unique, wildlife-rich landscapes. While Northern Tanzania is best known for Serengeti National Park, there are a number of other national parks and conservation areas that offer exceptional wildlife experiences, with fewer crowds and vehicles.

In this itinerary, you’ll visit three of these areas: Tarangire National Park, the Ngorongoro Crater Conservation Area, and Rubondo Island National Park. Each offers something unique. Tarangire National Park delivers a Big Five safari with varied landscapes, diverse bird species, and relatively few visitors.

The Ngorongoro Crater is the busiest of the three destinations in this itinerary, but with expert guides, you’ll descend into the crater early in the morning, before the crowds arrive, and have the opportunity to enjoy other activities such as hiking and authentic cultural experiences with the local Maasai community.

Finally, Rubondo Island National Park, which is perhaps the most unique of the three. This small island within vast Lake Victoria is almost entirely covered by pristine forest. It is home to just one camp; the only other human inhabitants are researchers studying the island’s habituated chimpanzees. Guests can enjoy game drives, birdwatching, boat safaris, catch-and-release fishing, and even join rangers on chimpanzee treks.

Throughout the journey, you’ll stay in luxurious lodges, each set in a prime location to maximise your game-viewing opportunities and offer breathtaking views across the wilderness.

dayInfo.description: After arriving in Tanzania, transfer from Kilimanjaro International Airport to a hotel in Arusha for an overnight stay.
You will be transferred to your camp in Tarangire National Park. Enjoy lunch at the luxury tented camp and relax on your private deck before experiencing your first game drive.

Spend your day exploring Tarangire National Park. The camp offers guided walking safaris and night drives. Tarangire National Park is home to an array of animals, including rarer species such as wild dogs, oryx and gerenuks.

Today you will travel towards the Ngorongoro Crater, arriving at your stunning camp, The Highlands, set on the slopes of Olmoti volcano. The Highlands is a small camp with eight unique domed suites that offer panoramic views of the surrounding forest.
Explore the Ngorongoro Crater Conservation Area, home to the ‘Big 5’. Enjoy game drives before returning to camp, where roaring fires will await guests in the cosy suites and lounge areas.

Travel to Rubondo Island National Park, a remote island on Lake Victoria. Rubondo Island Camp is the only camp on the protected island, which is wild and virtually uninhabited, apart from park wardens and researchers.

Explore the island, combining time spent relaxing in the peaceful surroundings with a range of activities. The activities on offer range from cookery classes and fishing trips to a chimpanzee habituation experience and guided forest walks.
Begin your journey home, having explored some of Tanzania’s hidden gems.

tourName: Mbede safari circuit luxury in Tanzania
generalInfo:
This Luxurious Africa Safari circuit, delivers a high-end service for our guest. The places we took you, provides Africa's Spectacular Wildlife Experience and Unique Scenery. There is full of unique culture experience to these sites and a non-stop adventure hosted in semi-tented camp,full tented camps to lodges.

In a nut shell, the entire experience is enriched by Cultural, Adventure,Wildlife,Walking, Fine dining,Gourmet cooking and a highly personalised Service.

dayInfo.description: Arriving at Kilimanjaro International Airport, then an hour drive to Arusha region to Overnight in Legendary Lodge

Wake up at Leisure , with a beautiful breakfast around coffee trees, then 1hour drive to Arusha National Park with packed lunch for an opening 3hours private gamedrive and later Overnight in Legendary Lodge
Early breakfast, then leave with packed lunch and a 2 hours drive to Tarangire National Park gate, then a Full day gamedrive in Tarangire National Park and overnight in Little ChemChem Lodge.
Early Morning Gamedrive with packed lunch, then coming back for a hot lunch in the lodge and later a cultural visit with Sundowner on the Lake, then Overnight in Little ChemChem
After breakfast, 1hour drive to Lake Manyara National Park Gate with Packed Lunch, then a full Day Gamedrive in Lake Manyara National Park and Overnight in Gibbs Farm
Depart early with packed breakfast and drive for 45minutes to Ngorongoro Crater gate, then a 6hours gamedrive down the crater floor but Hot lunch back at Gibbs farm and Overnight at Gibbs farm

After Breakfast, 1hour drive to Manyara Airstrip, followed by 1hour 25mnts flight to Sasakwa Airstrip, then 1hour drive to Singita Sabora,gamedrive enroute. A Hot Lunch at Singita Sabora, then Evening Gamedrive with beautiful sundowner on flat lands of sabora Overnight at Sabora tented Camp
Early Private gamedrive with packed breakfast and later a hot lunch at the camp, followed with evening Private gamedrive and Overnight at Sabora Camp
Private Gamedrive with Private Bush breakfast in Serengeti Sabora Camp and Explore the untouched wild places in Singita Grumeti game reserve, then Overnight in Singita Sabora Camp.

Wake up at leisure, Breakfast on the best unique view of Sabora plains , then 1hour drive to Sasakwa Airstrip, ready for 1hour 40mnts flight to Arusha Airport to have a day room at Legendary lodge before your International flight back home

tourName: Northern Tanzania and Zanzibar guided safari
generalInfo:
The 9 days experience designed to maximized the wildlife viewing and beach holiday by taking you to the Northern Tanzania finest parks of Ngorongoro crater and Tarangire National Park, then fly to Zanzibar islands . Ngorongoro believed to have formed some 2millions years ago, the crater harbors an astonishing varieties of landscapes from forests, peaks, craters, valleys, rivers to the lakes and plains. It is including the world famous Olduvai Gorge, where some of the our earliest human ancestors once hunt and gathered.
The lovely 2600-square -km(1004-square-mile) park is continued to be something of a well kept secrets. Being the sixth largest national park in Tanzania, Tarangire remains slightly off the main safari circuit but is a terrifically scenic park featuring classic African savannah, green hills, woodlands and rivers and is especially famous for its large herds of elephants, superb birdlife and giant baobab trees.

Zanzibar is the perfect spot if your looking for a little rest and relaxation after your adventure in the dust roads of Ngorongoro and Tarangire or Kilimanjaro trek. Zanzibar guarantees the ultimate relaxation on beautiful white, soft sandy beaches, while also offering opportunities for fun island activities.

dayInfo.description: Upon your arrival day at Kilimanjaro International Airport (JRO) and after M&G with our representative (driver guide), as the locals Tanzanians and over 10 years’ experience they know this country and her secrets. Then a transfer to you lodge. Transit time 1 hr.

After breakfast at your hotel head off to Tarangire National Park. This relative secrecy is odd because during the dry season it’s a part of the migratory movement and it’s second only to Ngorongoro Crater in concentration of wildlife. There are more than 500 species of birds in Tarangire National Park. Thousands of parched animals flock to the watering holes and thousands more makes their long way to the permanent water of the Tarangire River. Transit time 3 hrs.

After an early breakfast head off to Ngorongoro Crater for the crater tour. Just 10 miles wide, Ngorongoro Crater was formed from a collapsed volcano. It is now a self-sustaining ecosystem with the densest predator population in Africa – you may be able to spot the Big 5 in a single afternoon! Overnight at the camp located at the rim of the Ngorongoro Crater.

After breakfast at your tented camp in Ngorongoro located at the rim of the crater you'll drive to Arusha airport for your flight to Zanzibar upon arrival at Zanzibar international airport you will meet with our representative and transfer to Nungwi beaches for your much needed relaxation.
Leasure at the hotel with your own time you can arrange activities at the hotel reception
Today it's your last day in Zanzibar depend on your international flight schedule you'll be transfer to Zanzibar International airport for your flight back home.

tourName: Northern Tanzania fly-in luxury safari
generalInfo:
Tanzania is well established as one of the best wildlife-viewing destination in the World. Safaris follow the trail of giant herds of antelope or wildebeest across the Serengeti, while Lions lounge in the shade waiting for their next meal to trot by. On the horizon looms the conical silhouette of Kilimanjaro, beckoning the strong of lung and leg. This Safari is a uniquely and extensively combined bush flights and best accommodation to offer you the greatest safari experience, far from the beaten track, venturing deep into the beautiful celebrated Northern Tanzania National Parks at great comfort.

Classic Great Northern Tanzania Fly-In Safari gives a broader, horizon-reaching perspective of the African wildernesses that clients have come to see, free of traffic, poor roads and the minibus melee. Take you to the more secluded camps and lodges, offering bespoke access to the most game-rich areas for an in-depth, privileged safari experience with the most dedicated hosts, resident and intimately familiar with their surroundings.

dayInfo.description: Arrival/ Arusha- JAMBO! Upon arrival at Kilimanjaro Airport, you will be met by our customer care representative who will introduce the Driver Guide who will be with you throughout the safari. He will then assist you with the transfer to your hotel in Arusha, assist you with the hotel check-in and brief you on your program ahead (Bed/Breakfast)

Tarangire National Park - Spend the early morning enjoying a Coffee Plantation tour at an extra cost, get to know how Tanzanian grow and process their coffee. Also at no extra cost visit Shanga which is a heartwarming project based in Arusha Coffee Lodge to create unique, high-quality, handmade jewelry, glassware and homeware using recycled materials. These products are sold in Tanzania and all over the world, with profits being reinvested back into development of new products and further employment of disabled people. Employing over 55 Tanzanians with disabilities, Shanga has two shop and workshops. Later you will be transferred to Arusha Airport where you will fly Tarangire on Coastal Aviation departing at 1300hrs to arrive Tarangire at 1320hrs.Tarangire National Park is Tanzania’s best-kept secret on the northern safari circuit. Named after a nearby river called Tarangire, it has the same attractions as the parks up-north- the only difference is that this place is not usually as crowded as the other ones. Hot lunch will be served at lodge, following check in, depart for an afternoon game viewing drive in the park returning later as the sun sets. Spend the next day exploring Tarangire National Park. With an optional night game viewing drive This is a year-round park with distinct seasons offering different experiences, from dusty, dry and baking with animals clustered around the rapidly reducing river, to the fecund green season full of newborn animals and chattering birds. Overnight: Tarangire Treetops, Meals (Breakfast/ Lunch/ Dinner)

Serengeti National Park - Optional morning walking safari then you will be transferred to the airstrip to fly to Serengeti at 1120hrs arriving Serengeti Seronera at 1215hrs.Your guide will be eagerly be waiting for you to arrive at your camp in time for lunch followed by a classic afternoon super safari in the Serengeti. Overnight: Serengeti Pioneer Camp, Meals( Breakfast/ Lunch/ Dinner)

Serengeti National Park - Enjoy a full day game drives (meals taken in true safari style ‘in the bush’) in the vast and sensational Serengeti, which covers 14,763 sq km of endlessly rolling savannah. Venue for ‘the greatest wildlife show on Earth’, the annual migration of over one million wildebeest, the park is also renowned for its lions, cheetahs, zebras, giraffes and plains game. Overnight: Serengeti Pioneer Camp, Meal( Breakfast/ Lunch/ Dinner)

Ngorongoro Conservation Area - This morning enjoy a last game viewing in Serengeti and transfer to the airstrip where you will fly Manyara at 1115hrs to arrive 1150hrs.Your guide will be waiting for you, enjoy a one and half hour road transfer to the famous Ngorongoro Crater Conservation Area (NCCA), which features rolling plains, lakes, craters, mountains and dormant volcanoes. Arrive at lodge in time for lunch. Enjoy an afternoon at leisure with an optional visit to the Masai village to learn about their unique culture/Enjoy an optional walk depending on the season/also at an extra cost- no safari is complete without experiencing a traditional bush lunch. Relax under the natural canopy of an acacia tree, whilst your personal butler serves up a feast. Nothing is quite so essentially safari as this. Tailored service with cold drinks and your private chef preparing delicious meals surrounded by breathtaking surroundings in total privacy totally completes this Out of Africa experience. After enjoying your morning game drive, your guide will bring you to your private location within the Ngorongoro Crater where the camp team awaits to seat you. Overnight: Lemala Ngorongoro Camp, Meals( Breakfast/ Lunch/ Dinner)

Ngorongoro Conservation Area - After breakfast, descend into the ‘8th Wonder of the World’, a unique biosphere that has remained virtually unchanged since the dawn of time. Enclosed within its towering walls are grasslands, swamps, forests, saltpans, a fresh water lake and a glorious variety of birdlife. Here too are all the members of the ‘Big Five’ (lion, elephant, rhino, leopard and buffalo) as well as a large cast of plains game and one of Africa’s densest populations of predators. Enjoy a picnic lunch on the crater floor before climbing back up and driving to your camp in time for relaxation before dinner. Overnight: Lemala Ngorongoro Camp, Meals( Breakfast/ Lunch/ Dinner)

After breakfast drive to the beautiful Lake Manyara, a shallow alkaline lake that shimmers in a cleft in the Great Rift Valley. Enjoy lunch and check in at your lodge. Then later enjoy an afternoon game viewing in Lake Manyara National Park famous for its tree climbing lions. Later return to your lodge for dinner and overnight. Accommodation: Lake Manyara Escarpment Lodge, Meals( Breakfast/ Lunch/ Dinner)

Departure - Spend the day at leisure utilizing the lodge facilities or take an optional Mto Wa Mbu market shopping tour where you will get a chance to interact with the local community and also test your bargaining power or even a last game drive in Manyara where you will pay park entrance fee directly on your own cost. Later transfer to Manyara Airstrip where you will fly Kilimanjaro 1740hrs arriving at 1830hrs. Upon arrival connect with your outbound flight home. Say good bye to the wonderful country and promise to join us on another expedition.

tourName: Northern Tanzania luxury guided holiday
generalInfo: A super luxury fly/drive itinerary taking in all the main highlights of Northern Tanzania.  Staying in top quality lodges on an all inclusive basis.  Guaranteed to depart for 2 clients, maximum of 6 clients per 4 x 4 vehicle with departures every Sunday throughout the year. Easily extended with flights from Seronera to Kogatende (Northern Serengeti) for great wildebeest migration, or Southern circuit (Nyerere park), or fly directly to Zanzibar for some well deserved R & R to finish.

dayInfo.description: Arrive at Kilimanjaro International Airport: you will be met and transferred to Gran Melia Hotel for overnight.

After breakfast and your safari briefing, set off by 4x4 to Tarangire National Park. As you pass through the park gates, your adventure begins with thrilling game viewing, scanning the plains for elephants, big cats, and the park’s famous baobab-dotted landscapes. Arrive at the lodge for lunch, enjoy some time to relax, then head back out for an action-packed afternoon game drive. Return to the lodge for dinner and an overnight stay under the stars. Located in the heart of Tarangire, Ndovu Tented Lodge features 12 permanent tented suites surrounded by one of Tanzania’s most spectacular elephant habitats. Open year-round, it offers exceptional wildlife experiences, especially during the dry season when huge herds migrate through the park. Includes Full board including all meals, bottled/filtered water, juice, local beer, house wine by the glass, and non-premium spirits (premium drinks and laundry excluded).

Spend morning and afternoon game drives exploring the untamed beauty of Tarangire National Park, accompanied by your experienced safari guide whose deep knowledge of the land brings every moment to life. From the first light of dawn, venture across sweeping savannahs dotted with ancient baobabs, following elephant trails and scanning for prides of lion lounging in the shade. Your guide helps you spot elusive creatures—leopards draped across branches, cheetahs prowling the open plains, and the vibrant birdlife that makes Tarangire a birder’s paradise. As you travel from riverbeds to rolling hills, you may encounter towering giraffes, bustling zebra herds, buffalo, and an array of antelope. With expert insight and a keen eye for wildlife, your guide ensures every sighting becomes a story, making this full-day game drive a truly immersive and unforgettable safari experience.

Embark on a scenic drive through the Great Rift Valley to Lake Manyara. Stop in Mto wa Mbu at Ol Mesera Manyara for lunch and a live Makonde carving demonstration, where skilled artisans bring wood to life before your eyes. Then continue to the Ngorongoro Conservation Area, arriving at your lodge in the afternoon to gaze over the awe-inspiring Ngorongoro Crater, a wildlife paradise framed by dramatic cliffs. Cap the day with dinner and an overnight stay in this iconic setting.
