Accommodation Meliá Ngorongoro Lodge in Premiere Forest View Rooms on full board basis including all meals, bottled/filtered water, juice, local beer, house wine by the glass and non premium spirits (excludes premium drinks and laundry) Optional Experience Guests who wish to have an escorted walk on the crater rim with a conservation officer can make these arrangements in advance. The walk is about 2 hours and is strenuous due to the altitude of the crater rim

Rise early and descend into the magical Ngorongoro Crater. Spend the day on a thrilling game drive in this 102-square-mile wildlife paradise, where elephants gather to play and drink at waterholes, giraffes stretch gracefully to nibble acacia leaves, and flocks of flamingos colour the crater’s lakes pink. Keep an eye out for lions, rhinos, buffalo, zebras, wildebeest, and antelope as you explore. Pause for a picnic lunch at a breathtaking crater-side spot, then return to the rim and your lodge in the afternoon for dinner and an overnight stay with spectacular views.

Journey to the world-famous Serengeti National Park, a land of endless plains and spectacular wildlife. Along the way, stop at Olduvai Gorge, where the Leakey family made groundbreaking archaeological discoveries, and explore the small museum with fascinating artifacts. Visit a traditional Maasai village to experience local culture up close. Continue into the Serengeti, renowned for its vast savannahs, breathtaking landscapes, and incredible wildlife—including lions, elephants, cheetahs, and large herds of wildebeest and zebra. Stop for a hot lunch at Miracle Experience Seronera (set menu, drinks excluded). After lunch, head west toward the Mbalageti Hills, enjoying game viewing en route. Arrive at your lodge in the late afternoon to freshen up, then relax with dinner and an overnight stay in the heart of this legendary wilderness. Accommodation Meliá Serengeti Lodge in Lagoon View Rooms on full board basis including all meals, bottled/filtered water, juice, local beer, house wine by the glass and non-premium spirits (excludes premium drinks and laundry)

Final game drive en route to Seronera airstrip. Fly by scheduled flight to Arusha Airport (flight included) departing 1100 arriving 1220. You are met on arrival for a local lunch (set menu, drinks excluded). Then transfer to Kilimanjaro International Airport for your departure flight. Onward flights to Zanzibar are also possible.

tourName: Northern Tanzania private safari holiday
generalInfo:
Explore Tanzania and discover the best life time memories. This tour incorporates travelling with a private tour guide who offers a total flexibility in game viewing.

Despite Lake Manyara being a relatively small National Park, it is incredibly diverse with plenty of elephants, tree-climbing lions (getting rarer), leopards, giraffes and more than 400 species of birds. Serengeti offers the absolute classic African safari setting with the incredible annual wildebeest migration. Visit the world's largest crater which acts as a natural enclosure for almost every species of wildlife found in East Africa which includes the very rare black rhino. The Ngorongoro Crater is where you'll witness some of the densest population of wildlife in the world and it's a truly amazing.

dayInfo.description: Arrival/Arsha - Meet at Kilimanjaro airport and transfer to your hotel for 1 night. Accommodation: Kibo Palace Meals: Breakfast

Lake Manyara National Park - Departure to Lake Manyara National Park, two-thirds of whose territory is occupied by the lake where hundreds of hippopotamuses share the waters with 380 species of birds. In the savannah, it is the kingdom of impala, giraffe, zebra, buffalo and lions, while the forest is home to various species of monkeys in dense vegetation. Game drive in late afternoon. Overnight: Lake Manyara Serena Lodge Meals( Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)

Serengeti National Park - Morning game drive in the park. Departure to Olduvai Gorge, where Mary Leakey discovered fragments of human skeletons more than a million years old. Visit of the museum. Continue to the Serengeti National Park with game drive en route to your lodge. Serengeti Serena Lodge Meals( Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)

Serengeti National Park - Morning and afternoon game drives across the vast plains of Serengeti, the scene of the most impressive migration of wildebeest and zebras followed by their predators. The park is also the ideal habitat for cheetahs, the fastest mammal Overnight Serengeti Serena Lodge Meals (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)

Ngorongoro Crater- Departure to the protected area of Ngorongoro, world famous. In the hollow of this beautiful rugged bowl of 8,300 km2, live some 20,000 animals. Visit a Maasai Village, where you discover the customs and customs of this people. In the afternoon, game drive in this remarkable natural amphitheater sheltering almost all species of animals from East Africa (except the giraffe). Overnight Ngorongoro Serena Lodge Meals(Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)

Tarangire National Park- This morning, drive to the Tarangire National Park which has an amazing variety of plants (sausage trees, acacias) but is especially famous for the huge baobabs that dot its rocky slopes. The park also offers a very diverse fauna. In the afternoon, game drive in the park. Overnight Tarangire Sopa Lodge Meals (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)

Tarangire National Park-Game drives in the morning and late afternoon. The park is home to thousands of elephants who are fond of this site; the Tarangire River running through the park serves as a watering hole for wildlife throughout the year. Accommodation: Tarangire Sopa Lodge Meals: (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)

Arusha/ Departure - Game drive in the morning. Lunch at the lodge. In the afternoon drive to Arusha and transfer to Kilimanjaro Airport. SAY GOODBYE TO THE WONDERFUL COUNTRY AND PROMISE TO JOIN US ON ANOTHER EXPEDITION

tourName: Nyerere and Ruaha safari and Zanzibar holiday, Tanzania
generalInfo:
This is the kind of journey you’ll remember forever. Start with remote, crowd-free safaris in Tanzania’s wildest parks, then unwind on Zanzibar’s pristine, sun-drenched coast. Perfect for couples, families, or friends seeking something extraordinary.

Beginning in Ruaha National Park - vast, untamed, and blissfully quiet. Track lions, elephants, and rare wild dogs with hardly another vehicle in sight. Between game drives, relax by the pool, enjoy sundowners around the fire, and fall asleep to the sounds of the bush. Sunrise walking safaris, birdwatching among ancient baobabs, and picnics under acacias make each day unforgettable.

Next, Nyerere National Park offers a completely different wilderness: lush waterways, riverine forests, and astounding wildlife, including elephants and leopards. Glide on boat safaris, take guided walks, and end your evenings around the campfire as hippos call from the riverside.

Finally, swap the bush for the beach at Zanzibar White Sand Luxury Villas. Here, untouched coastline, turquoise waters, and barefoot relaxation await. Stroll along empty shores, swim in the Indian Ocean, or indulge in a massage - adventure and total escape are both at your fingertips.

dayInfo.description: On arrival in Dar es Salaam, you’ll transfer to the domestic terminal for a scenic flight to Ruaha National Park. In under three hours, enjoy breathtaking views as you descend into Tanzania’s untamed heart. Your guide will meet you at the airstrip and drive you to Jongomero Camp in time for lunch, before setting out on your first safari adventure that afternoon. You’ll spend the next three nights here. With just eight luxury tents, Jongomero offers a secluded and intimate base from which to explore the wild.

Each evening, plan the next day’s adventures with the camp team - from walking and game drives to choosing where to stop for lunch. Jongomero Camp is 70 km from the nearest lodge, giving you a truly private safari experience. Ruaha National Park is often overlooked, making it one of Tanzania’s quietest and most rewarding destinations. Expect big cat sightings, vast elephant herds, packs of wild dogs, and over 500 recorded bird species. A dawn walking safari is not to be missed. Wander dry riverbeds with an expert guide, discovering the fascinating stories of the local wildlife, plants, and birds. After your adventures, return to camp to relax, enjoy a sundowner, and savour delicious meals in this secluded wilderness.

Today you’ll embark on a contrasting safari adventure. After breakfast, transfer to the airstrip for a 90-minute flight to Nyerere National Park (formerly Selous Game Reserve), where your guide will meet you and drive you to Sand Rivers, your home for the next three nights. Sand Rivers is designed for complete immersion in nature. Check into one of the spacious luxury tents and enjoy the camp’s facilities, including a pool, bar, and lounge - the perfect place to relax and unwind in the heart of the wilderness.

Over the next three days, you’ll explore Nyerere National Park with a range of experiences offered by Sand Rivers - from game drives and walking safaris to boat excursions along the rivers and guided bush walks. At twice the size of Belgium, Nyerere is Africa’s largest park, yet far less visited than the Serengeti. This means your wildlife encounters are more private and intimate. With great herds of elephants and impressive numbers of big cats, the park offers some of Tanzania’s most impressive game viewing. Each evening, return to Sand Rivers to relax with sundowners around the campfire.

This morning you will be transferred back to the airstrip to catch a short flight over to Zanzibar. You will be met on arrival and transferred to your stunning home for the next four nights - Zanzibar White Sands Luxury Villas

On Zanzibar’s pristine coastline, White Sands Luxury Villas offers the ultimate escape. Stroll along empty white-sand beaches, swim in the turquoise Indian Ocean, or simply unwind in your elegant villa. Indulge in world-class cuisine, from fresh seafood to vibrant local flavours, paired with perfectly made cocktails. Every detail exudes pure luxury, making it the perfect place to relax, recharge, and enjoy the beauty of the island.
After breakfast, you will say your goodbyes and be transferred to the airport for your international flight home.

tourName: Nyerere NP & Mafia Island holiday in Tanzania
generalInfo: On this journey you'll visit The Nyerere National park, the largest area of protected pristine wilderness remained in Africa and the jewel of the Indian ocean,  Mafia Island. The big advantage of visiting Nyerere National is that most of the game viewing will be done from the water, you'll also engage in different activities like walking, camping and a boat tour. It's always spectacular watching a heard of elephants showering, playing and having fun, as you sit in a boat in the middle of river Rufiji.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Tanzania! Upon arrival at Julius Nyerere International Airport, you'll meet with your guide and you'll be transferred to your hotel at the shores of Indian Ocean for the evening relaxing.

Today after an early breakfast you'll be transferred to Nyerere National park through the Mtemere gate. Arriving at your camp in the afternoon for the hot lunch. The camp is situated 20minutes from the Mtemere gate and later on in the afternoon drive to the park for your afternoon game drive and return to the camp before dark.

Today early morning with your picnic breakfast drive off to the park for your half day game drive, explore the beauty of the Nyerere National Park with your opened 4x4 land cruiser. Most of the game viewing and birds watching will be done along the lakes and swamps. Return to the camp in the afternoon for your hot lunch, and then proceeding with the boat tour in the afternoon.

Today early morning head off to the park for your early morning game viewing with an option of guided nature walk , walking through the bush or beside a river is a rare opportunity to get up close with the nature.Return to the camp in the afternoon for your lunch and in the evening go for the boat tour you never know what's around the Rufiji River.

Today after the breakfast head off to Dar es salaam for your flight to Mafia Island. Mafia Island is a jewlery of the Indian Ocean, the whaleshark and humpback whales, the kilometers of beutiful pristine coastline just waiting for you.

Today after the breakfast , head off for snorkel in the Mafia Island which offers an extraordinary diversity of marine life and provide some of the most spectacular coral reefs. Late on visit to Chole Island the oldest still inhabited settlement in the archipelago , with the remains of old Arab buildings used by the Germans during war 1.

Today in the morning enjoy a dhow sail around the the Chole Bay. The dhow is a traditional boat which has been used for the manys years in the coast of East Africa. In the afternoon rest and relax at the beach.

Today it's your last day in Mafia, after the breakfast you'll be transferred to Mafia Airport for your flight to Dar es salaam and later on connect with your International flight from Nyerere International Airport. End of the safari in Tanzania and welcome back!

tourName: Ona Circuit luxury safari Tanzania
generalInfo:
This safari can be tailored for all ages from children to adults. Activities include game viewing, nature walks, exercise walk, birding and if you are interested, biking around villages on local routes, cultural visits to local communities, night game drives and star gazing.

When we take you to local places, we mean local and not touristic. We are here to create memories for you with professional guides who are experienced, friendly, knowledgeable , positive attitude , enthusiastic and have sense of humour.

We are a conservation travel brand started out from two proud conservationists with the belief of conserving these beautiful places and saving their people from the more negative effects commerce. We are local operators spent a lot of time in field, Before we take you there we experience these places first because we want to provide the best for our guest. Your are to be warmly serviced by people who are kind, who are thoughtful, who understand what guests are looking for, and who know how to respond to their requests and to exceed their expectations. They are professional and dedicated. Safety and Healthy its our priority.

dayInfo.description: Arriving at Kilimanjaro International Airport and drive to one of the best luxurious lodge in Arusha. Our team will be there at the Airport with your name right after coming off your international flight, waiting to assist you with all the procedures. Fill all the paper work needed, carry your luggage and escort you to our Proffesional Guide who by then will be there waiting to take you to Arusha for the night.
Arusha town tour or game drive introduction in Arusha National Park, so as to adjust their Body and Brain (BB) to Africa time due to time zone change.

A flight to Tarangire National Park or a 2hrs drive from the lodge to Tarangire National Park with packed lunch, spend a day on game drive inside the park and later stay for two nights in one of the luxurious lodge in Tarangire, some are private owned concession with beautiful private game drives and other activities within.

After breakfast or with packed breakfast, A game drive en-route Manyara National Park to Ngorongoro crater and in the afternoon we have an arrangement for a Iraqw community tour or maasai community tour.

Leave early for Ngorongoro Crater with packed breakfast, do the half day game drive in Crater and coming back for the hot late lunch to the lodge. If the guest are keen then they will do local Cow milking or enjoy the Maasai Stories at the fireplace in a beautiful organic vegetable garden whilst enjoy their gin/tonic at sundowner.

After Coffee roasting early in the morning you will have your own roasted coffee for breakfast and drive to Manyara Airport, thereafter fly to a private concession on Western part of Serengeti for 3 nights doing game drives, walking, bike riding or night game drives at Africa Starry Night.

After breakfast you will fly back to Arusha and have a day room ,Lunch, Re-freshing in one of the luxurious lodge before an evening drive to Kilimanjaro International Airport. On your arrival at the Airport, our team will be there to ensure your Safari is A Hassle-free way. They will invite you, escort you, carry your luggage, assist you to clear all the paper works at the Airport whilst you sitting, relaxing and thinking of all your Safari Experience. End of your Safari.

tourName: Premium Tanzania holiday, small group
generalInfo: Set off on an in-depth exploration of Tanzania’s natural wonders on this eight-day Premium adventure. Take a front-row seat to soak in the magnificent landscapes and wildlife of Tarangire National Park, stop for a picnic lunch on the floor of the Ngorongoro Crater and explore Serengeti National Park on an exciting series of 4WD game drives. Relax at your Feature Stay in Serengeti, explore the national reserve’s plains with a local guide whose grown up on the land, and look for roaming wildlife like elephants, zebras and hippos every step of the way.  Dine beneath the stars, sip drinks at sunset and fall asleep to the sounds of East Africa.

dayInfo.title: Arusha.
dayInfo.description: Karibu! Welcome to Tanzania. Your adventure begins in Arusha – your gateway to the incredible national parks of Tanzania. When you arrive at Kilimanjaro Airport, you’ll be met by a local representative and transferred to your hotel, where your adventure officially begins with a welcome meeting at 6 pm tonight. Located on the woodland slopes of Mount Meru, in the heart of a traditional coffee farm, your hotel offers fantastic views of Lake Duluti. If you arrive early, maybe visit the Natural History Museum or head to the Ngaramtoni Market to shop for handicrafts. After your meeting, join your leader and fellow travellers for a short walk to the shores of the lake, where you’ll find chairs and lamps set up for a private welcome dinner. Watch the sunset as you toast to the beginning of a new adventure.

dayInfo.title: Tarangire National Park .
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you’ll travel to Tarangire National Park. Dotted with baobab trees, this area experiences its own small-scale migration, as animals travel from Tarangire to Lake Manyara in search of water and grass. Your accommodation here is a permanent tented camp in the heart of the park with wonderful views of the Tarangire River. During the migration periods, you may see zebras, wildebeest and elephants passing by the veranda of your tent – a true African bush experience. In the afternoon, set out in search of wildlife on a 4WD game drive through the national park.

dayInfo.title: Ngorongoro Highlands.
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, set out on a sunrise4WD game drive. Tarangire National Park is populated with elephants, herds of cape buffalo, gazelles, Burchell’s zebras, giraffes and warthogs. Their predators also roam the park – look out for lions, cheetahs, leopards, hyenas, jackals and even African wild dogs. If you look to the skies, you’ll see the park’s abundant array of birdlife. After, continue your journey to the Ngorongoro Highlands. Along the way, stop at a local farmers’ market for a look at local life. Watch traders and buyers haggle over the prices of a colourful array of fruits and vegetables – your leader will pick up some seasonal fruits for you to try yourself.

dayInfo.title: Serengeti National Park.
dayInfo.description: Today, you’ll make your way to the wide-open plains of the Serengeti. Travel through the UNESCO World Heritage-listed Ngorongoro Conservation Area, skirting the mighty volcanic Ngorongoro Crater. Arrive at the Endless Plains of the Serengeti – they span some 14,700 sq km, home to about three million animals! Here, you might see wildebeest, zebras, gazelles, lions, cheetahs, warthogs, hyenas, hippos and ostriches. This afternoon, head out on a 4WD game drive in the southern regions of the Serengeti for your first look at the park’s wildlife. In the evening, retire to your Feature Stay accommodation – a permanent tented camp in the breathtaking wilderness of the Serengeti. With no fences, this magnificent eco-camp allows you to really connect with your wild surroundings without sacrificing modern comforts.

dayInfo.title: Serengeti National Park.
dayInfo.description: You may like to spend the morning on a hot air balloon safari over the great plains. After, you'll have a full day game drive. The interactions between the many species of the Serengeti plains often provide some of the best wildlife viewing opportunities in the world! Watch the landscape change in the park from the vast treeless central plains to thick scrubs and forests in the north. Linking these areas is the savannah, punctuated by acacia trees and rock outcrops. Return to camp around midday, and take some time to relax in the shade. Then, when it’s cooled down and the animals are more active, set out again for an afternoon game drive. Tonight, try a refreshing sundowner (an iconic part of traditional safari life).

dayInfo.title: Ngorongoro Highlands.
dayInfo.description: This morning, say goodbye to the Serengeti National Park and travel back to the Ngorongoro Crater Conservation Area – one of Africa's most beautiful nature reserves and the world's largest intact caldera. Within this crater lies every type of ecosystem, including riverine forests, open plains, freshwater and alkaline lakes. On your game drive through the crater, look for roaming wildlife like the highly endangered black rhinoceros! Then, stop for a picnic lunch on the crater floor before continuing with your game drive. After, you’ll continue on to the Ngorongoro Highlands.

dayInfo.title: Ngorongoro Highlands.
dayInfo.description: This morning is free for you to explore at your own pace Then, set off on a hands-on tour of a local coffee plantation. Learn all about the coffee process, from seed to bean to cup! In the afternoon, spend some time relaxing by the pool or speak to your leader about the other activities available.

dayInfo.title: Arusha.
dayInfo.description: This morning, depart the lodge and make the drive back to Arusha. When you arrive in Arusha about midday, your adventure comes to an end. If you would like to extend your stay in Arusha, just speak to your booking agent ahead of time.

tourName: Safari and Zanzibar beach holiday, Tanzania
generalInfo: The Maasai are a proud community in northern Tanzania, recognized for their bright red clothing, beautiful beadwork, and unique traditions. Cattle are at the heart of their way of life, symbolizing wealth, food, and culture. They are also famous for their energetic jumping dance and strong sense of identity. Your stay at Tembo Lodge is an invitation to explore, connect, and make a difference. From breathtaking savannah vistas and mountain hikes to cultural encounters with Maasai communities, this is the real Tanzania —authentic, personal, and unforgettable. you will get a chance to visit Mkomazi is in northern Tanzania, part of a large ecosystem, with rare colobus monkeys, a rich savannah, and a large gerenuk population, wild dog and rhino sanctuary .Later you will unwind at stone town with some activities and also enjoy the beach.

dayInfo.description: Upon your arrival day at Kilimanjaro International Airport (JRO) and after M&G with our representative (driver guide). Your journey begins the moment you arrive at Tembo Lodge. Warmly greeted by the Maasai staff, you settle into your charming bungalow and take in sweeping views of the savannah and distant mountains. Connect with the Maasai culture in a playful spear-throwing session guided by skilled warriors, then join the Maasai sundowner dance as the sun sets painting the plains with warm magical colors of an African sunset. Sip a refreshing drink, enjoy a light snack, and end the evening around a crackling bonfire, sharing stories beneath a sky full of stars.

Spend the day connecting with the heart of the Maasai community. Visit the local school supported by the lodge, meet the children, and see how education is making a real impact on the next generation and the wider community. In the evening, step into a traditional Maasai boma to experience daily life and gain insight into a culture that has thrived in harmony with the land for centuries.

Early in the morning, you set out with packed breakfast and lunch for a full day adventure to the Enduimet Wildlife Management Area, just an hour drive from Tinga Tinga. Lying at the foot of Mount Kilimanjaro, it is known for its large elephant population and unspoiled landscapes. With few visitors, Enduimet offers a rare, authentic safari where wildlife and the Maasai live side by side. Expect sweeping views, diverse wildlife, and a true sense of wilderness before returning to the lodge in the afternoon. In the evening join the Maasai for a traditional Maasai BBQ around the fireplace.

An early wake-up call with coffee and then wander through the savanna on a guided bushwalk, learning about local plants and Maasai traditions. With wildlife as your next door neighbours, you might come across giraffes and zebras along the way. After breakfast, step into the highlight of the Maasai week with a visit to the vibrant local market. Here the villagers gather not only to trade but also to connect- sharing stories, laughter, and news of daily life. Fresh vegetables, local shoes, colorful fabrics and even goats and cattle making the market a lively window into the Maasai culture. You´ll also meet the women´s groups supported by the lodge’s NGO Maasailand Development: a sewing and a beadwork group. Sit with them, learn traditional craft, and perhaps create a piece of beadwork yourself. Their beautiful designs bring life and color to Tembo Lode, each piece carrying a story of tradition and empowerment.

Today after the breakfast you can have early morning game drive and later head off to Mkomazi national Park, via Kilimanjaro North scenic route, upon your arrival you'll proceed with the game drive. Drive to your camp before dark for the overnight stay

Today early in the Moring start your game in this less visited park enjoy the sundown and the sunrise from the magnificent mountain views found in this park. Visit the rhinoceros and the wild dog’s projects situated in the park. Return to your camp in the afternoon for the overnight stay. The tented lodge is located inside the park.

After breakfast drive to Kilimanjaro airport for your flight to Zanzibar upon arrival at Zanzibar international airport you will meet with our representative and transfer to the hotel in stone town.The Emerson team offers a full-evening dining experience with a Swahili and Middle Eastern theme, starting at 6:00 PM with cocktails, mocktails, and an aperitif. The waiters will introduce you to the menu, the setting, and the traditions surrounding Zanzibar celebrations. At 7:00 PM, the first course of the meal is served, and musicians from the Dhow Countries Music Academy begin playing traditional Taarab music. Dinner continues with a variety of dishes, and the evening concludes unusually around 9:00 PM to 9:30 PM with a cup of "tangawizi"—Zanzibar ginger tea—after dessert is served.

Stone Town tour Stone Town is the old city and cultural heart of Zanzibar and little has changed in the last 200 years. It is a place of winding alleys, bustling bazaars, mosques and grand Arab houses. Stone Town has brought together many different elements of the cultures of Africa, the Arab region, India, and Europe over more than a thousand years. You can spend endless hours just wandering through the fascinating labyrinth of narrow streets and alleyways, absorbing the years of history. You will enjoy a guided tour of this fascinating town, recently and deservedly declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Late afternoon Mahanjumati tour (food tour with Forodhani) In Kiswahili, “mahanjumati” means a feast of different delicacies. Zanzibar’s cuisine reflects the island’s cosmopolitan spirit. Indian, Arab, Persian, African and Western influences create a wide variety of tasty dishes and snacks. Most of these won’t be served in tourist restaurants; they are prepared in Swahili homes and small local eateries. On this leisurely walk through Stone Town’s alleyways, we will take you to the best (and hygienically safe!) places to sample these local delicacies. Make it a breakfast or dinner experience, depending on your timing!

Spice tour Today you will visit one of the island's many spice plantations. The export of exotic spice has unfortunately been drastically reduced in the last century, yet Zanzibar still boasts the excellent quality and wide variety of spice and tropical fruit. During a tour at such a Spice Farm you will see and taste many different herbs, and the guide will explain to you all about its cultivation and use. Cloves, cinnamon, vanilla, cumin, cardamom, nutmeg, ginger, chili, black pepper, but also guava, mango, pineapple, papaya.... All these delicious flavours and textures will certainly be found in the meals at your hotel. Sunset cruise Zanzibar is known for its beautiful sunsets. A unique and enjoyable way to enjoy them is with a sunset cruise on a dhow. A dhow is a traditional Arabic wooden sailing boat that is still widely used here. The cruise lasts approximately two hours. If the wind cooperates, the crew will hoist the sails so you can peacefully enjoy the beautiful surroundings as the sun slowly sinks below the horizon. Drinks and snacks are served on board.

Snorkelling with Sandbank / Deserted Beach BBQ (from Kizimkazi) Leave from Kizimkazi, lean back and enjoy the sound of the waves for 1.5 hours sailing until you reach the Pungume corals - one of Zanzibar's top 3 snorkelling spots. After snorkelling you will continue to a deserted beach far from mass tourism or the Pungume sandbank if the tides allow. While enjoying the beach, the sea and the view, the crew will prepare a delicious BBQ that is guaranteed to impress you with the local cuisine. Sea treasures together with local specialities and exotic fruits are on the menu. After lunch it’s time for a little rest, reading, taking a swim or just enjoying the breathtaking views. With a cold beverage in hand and a camera to immortalize paradise, there is not much more you need...
Leisure at the beach
Leisure at the beach
Today it's your last day in Zanzibar depend on your international flight schedule you'll be transfer to Zanzibar International airport for your flight back home.

tourName: Selous safari & Mafia Islands diving holiday
placesVisited: Selous Game Reserve, Game drives, Walking safaris, Boat excursions on Rufiji River, Mafia Island, Optional: diving, snorkelling, Swahili village visits, bird watching, coastal forest walks
generalInfo:
Discover Tanzania’s wildest, most off the beaten track areas, with this Selous safari and Mafia Islands diving holiday. It’s a perfectly paced mix of wildlife spotting and island relaxation, with four nights in Selous Game Reserve in the south of the country, followed by six nights on the Mafia Archipelago, where remote sandy beaches are perfect for relaxation and the clear seas are a diver’s paradise.

Selous is Africa’s largest game park, just a 40 minute flight from Dar es Salaam. It’s home to huge populations of buffalo and lion, and is one of the few places in Africa where you have a good chance of spotting rare wild dogs. In addition, you’ll come across masses of wildebeest, zebra and impala, and it’s possible to see herds of 50 or more giraffe drinking from lakes during the hottest part of the day.
As well as game drives in the morning and evening, there’s the option to take a walking safari and boat trip on the Rufiji River and lakes. You’ll be accompanied by an expert wildlife guide and you have the freedom to choose what you’d like to do each day – they are all included in the price.

After your safari, take a short 40 minute flight to the remote and almost unknown Mafia Islands in the Indian Ocean. The islands are covered in rainforest and grasslands, with tiny villages dotted here and there, and barrier reefs out to sea. A large part of Mafia Island itself is a protected Marine Park and you can explore its biodiversity by snorkelling and scuba diving, through coastal forest walks and bird watching. Learn about Swahili village life and traditional culture, too, by visiting its villages.

The best time do this itinerary is mid June to late October. This is the dry season, game viewing is good and the climate is comfortable.

dayInfo.description: You'll depart for Tanzania today on an overnight flight to Dar es Salaam.

Upon arrival in Dar es Salaam you will take a light aircraft flight to the Selous Game Reserve, one of Africa's largest yet visited by few. Meandering through the plains and woodlands, the Rufiji River gives rise to a labyrinth of streams, channels and pretty lakes in a delicate water paradise. You will arrive in time for lunch and will then be able to relax, refresh and unpack before your afternoon game activity.

During your time in the Selous you'll be in for some close wildlife encounters. You can arrange your days to suit, taking part in game drives, bush walks or boat safaris. The Selous is one of the few places in Tanzania where you might see the incredibly rare wild dog, otherwise known as the painted wolf. They've become a cult sighting for wildlife lovers, and the guides and trackers of the camp will give you the best possible chance of seeing them.

After a morning of game activities, you will take a light aircraft flight from the Selous to to Mafia Island via Dar es Salaam, enjoying views of the turquoise Indian Ocean as you fly. Mafia and its surrounding islands are covered in rich rainforest, thick grasslands and giant baobab trees, and dotted with tiny villages. Sunbirds flit through the trees, five species of endemic butterflies can be found and bushbabies call at night. All that said, it is in the turquoise waters that you'll find the islands' biggest attractions. Unspoiled barrier reefs surround the islands, rich in soft corals, sea anemones and sponges, and attracting a dazzling array of fish. From sunrise to sunset Mafia is magical and as yet little visited.

Spend your days relaxing in the beautiful surroundings on Mafia Island. The lodge works closely with a local dive centre where you can arrange snorkelling and diving trips to the numerous reefs in Chole Bay. We recommend taking a trip out in a traditional dhow boat to dive and snorkel around the beautiful untouched reefs nearby, bursting with marine life. You could also visit the Swahili ruins on Chole Island where you can take a guided village walk to see the island's famous colony of endangered fruit bats.
Today you will fly from Mafia back to Dar es Salaam where you will catch your overnight flight back to London.
You'll arrive in London this morning.

tourName: Serengeti great migration safari, Tanzania
generalInfo:
The short grass plains are what the southern Serengeti is famous for. The soils are fertile, supporting up to two million animals during the rainy season.

December to March is the calving season where the migration of zebras and wildebeests are calving on the plains of southern Serengeti (Ndutu area), offering dramatic wildlife experiences that never to forget. After the short rains of November the grass on the plains become greener hence attract millions of wildebeests and zebras it's calving season.. .It's the lions seasons!!

dayInfo.description: Welcome Tanzania! Upon arrival at Arusha airport you'll be meet with your guide and transferred to your lodge in Arusha for overnight stay. Transit time 1hr

Today after breakfast at the lodge, drive to southern Serengeti for the afternoon game drive. The Onset of the November's short rain season turn the plains of Serengeti into green carpet thus attract millions of wildebeests and hundreds thousands of zebras. It's calving seasons! It's lions seasons. Transit time 6hrs30.

Today an early morning game drive. Enjoy the morning sunrise while exploring the plains and the woodland of southern serengeti, Return to your camp for the lunch and proceed with the afternoon game drive later on and return to the camp before dark for the overnight stay.

Today after an early breakfast drive to Central Serengeti with the game on route.From the sea of the waving grass dotted with umbrellas acacias and ants hills to the rivers and water holes Serengeti is the home of the big cats. Arrive at your camp before dark for dinner and overnight stay.

After an early breakfast drive to Ngorongoro highlands for the crater tour. At just 10 miles wide, Ngorongoro crater was formed from a collapsed volcano. It’s now a self- sustaining ecosystem with the densest predator populations in all of Africa. Transit time 3hrs.
Today after breakfast, you will be transferred to Kilimanjaro International Airport for your flight back home or extend your holiday to Zanzibar or Mafia island.

tourName: Serengeti holiday in Tanzania, the big five
generalInfo:
Discover Tanzania’s Ultimate Safari Adventure

Embark on an unforgettable journey through Tanzania’s legendary northern circuit, where two of Africa’s most spectacular wildlife destinations await: the Serengeti and the Ngorongoro Crater.
The Serengeti – Where the Wild Still Roams Free
Just the mention of Serengeti stirs the imagination — endless golden plains, dotted with iconic acacia trees, alive with Africa’s greatest wildlife spectacle. Watch lions surveying the horizon from rocky kopjes, hyenas bickering over a feast, and vultures soaring overhead. Here, every game drive is a front-row seat to nature’s greatest theater.

Ngorongoro Crater – Nature’s Living Eden
Descend into the world’s largest intact volcanic caldera, formed two million years ago, and step into a wildlife paradise unlike anywhere else. The crater floor dazzles with shimmering lakes painted pink by flamingos, lush forests, and sweeping grasslands. With the highest concentration of predators on earth, encounters with lions, leopards, jackals, and hyenas are almost guaranteed. Lucky guests may even spot the elusive cheetah!

Beyond the Safari Jeep
Your adventure doesn’t stop with game drives. Take a guided walk with an armed ranger along the Ngorongoro rim or the remote Empakai Crater for breathtaking vistas. Or, journey back in time with a visit to Olduvai Gorge, the world-renowned “Cradle of Humankind,” where some of our earliest ancestors once roamed.
This is more than a safari. It’s a once-in-a-lifetime experience that will stay with you forever.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Tanzania! Upon arrival at Kilimanjaro International Airport you'll meet with your guide and transferred to your lodge in Arusha for an overnight stay. As locals Tanzanians, our guides know the country with unrivaled familiarity so you’ll be in good hands from the moment you land to the time you leave. Transit time 1hr.

Today after breakfast head off to Tarangire National Park for a game drive. This relative secrecy is odd because during the dry season it's a part of the migratory movement and is second only to Ngorongoro Crater in concentration of wildlife. Later on drive to your lodge for an overnight stay.

Today after breakfast drive to Ngorongoro highlands for Crater tour .Ngorongoro Crater believed to have formed some 2 millions years ago, harbors an astonishing variety of landscapes-forests ,peaks ,craters, valleys ,rivers and lake and plains including the world famous Olduvai Gorge, where some of our earliest human ancestors once hunted and gathered. Late in the afternoon drive to Serengeti with game on route,arrive at your tented camp before dark. Transit time from Ngorongoro crater to Serengeti is 3hrs.

Today a fully day game drive in Serengeti, enjoy the beautiful sunrise in the morning, game drive through the phenomenon landscapes from the sea of waving grass to the rock out crop hills which are the hiding places for lioness and leopards . The Serengeti ecosystem supports some of the most plentiful mammal populations left anywhere on earth, and animals here seems bigger, stockier, stronger, and studier than elsewhere in Africa. Return to the camp before dark for overnight.

Today early morning after breakfast you'll be transferred to Kilimanjaro International airport for your flight back home or you can extend this program to Zanzibar or Mafia Islands . This will be the end of your trip to Tanzania.

tourName: Serengeti migration safari in Tanzania
generalInfo: The great migration! Nothing will prepare you for the spectacle that is the great migration. This annual journey of 2 million animals is the safari seekers Holy Grail; the ultimate in wildlife experiences. Some says its one of the world greatest natural wonders. In June and July the columns of 40 km long have to cross the crocodile infested Mara River. Half of the great herds which are successful and survive the crossing will stay in Northern Tanzania the other half will cross over to Kenya's Masai Mara.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Tanzania! Upon arrival in Tanzania you will meet your guide at Kilimanjaro International Airport who will escort you to your lodge in Arusha town for a relaxing. Arusha is the Tanzania Northern circuits tourists harbor. As locals Tanzanians, our guides know the country with unrivaled familiarity so you’ll be in good hands from the moment you land to the moment you leave. Overnight at Planet lodge on bed and breakfast.

Today is the beginning of your adventure, after breakfast drive off to Tarangire National park. Tarangire it's known as the elephants play ground, has the largest elephant population per every square km than any other park in the world. keep a lookout for the hundreds of birds species, Tarangire river is known for dramatic interactions between predators and prey animals especially during the dry season. Overnight at Tarangire safari lodge located inside the park on full board basis. Transit time from Arusha to Tarangire 2hrs

After breakfast drive to iconic Serengeti National Park, where acacia trees and granite kopjes dot the seas of the waving grass. The Serengeti offers everyday opportunities to spot Tanzania's most impressive wildlife-including big cats and witness dramatic moment of the Great migration of wildebeest and zebras. Overnight at the Sound of Silence camp at Central Serengeti on full board. Transit time From Tarangire to Serengeti is 4hrs.

Today after breakfast from the camp, you'll be transferred to Northern Serengeti (Kogatende area) game on route, for Migration crossing the Mara river. Today your journey will take you through difference scenery landscapes from the Lobo hills to Bologonja streams the areas with plenty of game viewing. Most actiivities will be done around Mara river and Lamai triangle, off course to see wildebeests crossing need Patience! The 2 nights here you'll stay at Mara tented camp.
Today after breakfast from your camp, you will be transferred to central Serengeti game on route and you'll arrive at your camp before dark. Overnight at Sound of Silence camp

After breakfast drive to Ngorongoro crater- Ngoro Ngoro crater which is Just 10 miles wide, was formed from collapsed volcano. It’s now a self- sustaining ecosystem with the densest predator populations in all of Africa. Overnight at Rhino lodge on full board basis. The transit time today is 3hrs. From Ngorongoro crater to Rhino lodge is 45minutes.

Today Morning After breakfast you'll be transferred to Kilimanjaro International airport for your flight back home or extend your holiday to Zanzibar or Mafia Islands. This is the end of your experience thank you so much and welcome again.

tourName: Southern Tanzania luxury safari holiday
placesVisited: Selous, Impala Camp, Ruaha, Jongomero Camp, Dar es Salaam
generalInfo:
This luxury safari holiday takes you to some of the best game viewing spots in Southern Tanzania – the wild and remote Selous Game Reserve and Ruaha National Park. In the Selous you’ll stay at Sand Rivers, which sitsright above the banks of the Rufiji River. It’s the perfect setting for birdwatching, boating safaris and fishing, game drives and walking safaris.

In Ruaha National Park you’ll find true wilderness and will come across few other visitors. Kichaka Frontier Camp is known for its incredible walking safaris, led by the expert Moli, but game drives and fly campingare available as well. Big cats and elephant are often seen in the park, and there’s also a good chance of seeing the endangered African wild dog.

September and October are the best months to visit Selous and Ruaha – the grasses have thinned after the long dry season, making the animals easier to spot, and the weather is warm, with clear skies for stargazing.

dayInfo.description: Arriving at the airport, your safari starts with a light aircraft flight into the heart of the Selous Game Reserve, just 45 minutes from Dar es Salaam. You get some great views of the Rufiji River and tall borassus palms as you fly in over the reserve. After settling into Sand Rivers, head out on a guided boat safari, gliding over the water as you watch out for hippo and crocodiles and admire the sunset. Tonight in camp you can enjoy a bush dinner by lamplight, and choose what you'd like to do tomorrow.

On your first few days of safari in Selous, whether you've chosen bush walks, game drives or boat safaris (or a combination of them all), you'll be in for some close wildlife encounters. You could see lion, elephant, wild dogs, zebra, wildebeest, giraffe, impala and eland, as well as the elusive leopard. Each game activity is led by an expert guide and with a small group of guests from the camp. Building a camaraderie with your fellow safari-goers, you can recall tales from your day's adventure while gathered around the dinner table or campfire in the evenings.

After a morning of game viewing, you will set off in the afternoon on foot accompanied by a ranger who will share their knowledge and passion for the reserve's wildlife as well as ensuring your safety. Being on foot gives you a completely different perspective to being in a vehicle, allowing you to appreciate the smaller details, from the wonderful birdlife to paw prints in the dirt. You feel far more immersed in the landscape, and your proximity to the wildlife provides you with many stories to take home. You'll end your guided bush walk at a fly camp, sitting around the campfire and watching the stars.

You're likely to wake with first light this morning, and after breakfast you will walk through the bush back to camp. In the afternoon you will have a chance to do a game drive or boat trip before your final night in camp.

After breakfast this morning you will catch a light aircraft flight over the hills to the Ruaha National Park. Here you'll stay at Kichaka Frontier Camp, made up of just three luxurious tents with views over the grasslands located in the Landa section of the park. You'll arrive in time for lunch and your first afternoon game drive.

The game viewing in Ruaha is prolific with ungulates including impala, waterbuck, bushbuck, giraffe, zebra and buffalo. Both greater and lesser kudu are present, as well as roan and sable antelope. There are large prides of lion, often twenty or more, spotted, as well as striped hyena, packs of wild dog and leopard. The birdlife is particularly colorful, and sitting in camp it's not unusual to spot many species such as emerald spotted doves, brown parrots and crested barbets. You have the opportunity for both game drives and walking safaris, but Kichaka's specialty is walking.

Wildlife viewing is particularly rewarding in the dry season when the game congregates at water sources. With only a few camps in the park and Kichaka situated in a remote section of it, visitor numbers are few and it's unspoilt and peaceful.

The emphasis on your safari from Kichaka Frontier Camp, with your host and guide Moli, is on the walking safaris which really unveil the magic of Ruaha. Moli is one of the best and most experienced guides in Tanzania and knows the park like the back of his hand. The focus of the walk is to take in the smaller details of the bush, tracking animals by their footprints, stopping to admire birdlife in the trees, and watching smaller creatures and their behaviors without the noise and disturbance of a vehicle. Larger game such as elephant and buffalo may be encountered, too, and Moli will instruct you on how to behave in order to remain safe around these larger animals.

You'll fly back to Dar es Salaam today and if you have time in the afternoon you can do a bit of shopping at the Slipway and enjoy your last Tanzanian meal. You'll then begin your overnight journey home to London.
Arrive early morning in Heathrow.

tourName: Tanzania 6 day safari
generalInfo: Embark on an unforgettable adventure through Tanzania's top safari destinations, including Tarangire National Park, Serengeti, and the Ngorongoro Crater. Witness the famed Great Migration and spot the Big Five amidst stunning landscapes. This safari tour offers thrilling game drives, close encounters with diverse wildlife, and the opportunity to explore ancient Maasai culture. Perfect for nature enthusiasts and photographers alike, this immersive experience promises once-in-a-lifetime memories in Africa's premier wildlife conservation areas.

dayInfo.description: Arusha - Tarangire National Park, Tanzania: Arusha - Tarangire National Park (L/D) Get ready to be picked up from your Moshi/Arusha accommodation and start your safari journey towards Tarangire National Park. Enjoy your afternoon game ride in Tarangire National park with a picnic lunch. This park is a home to up to 300 elephants, mainly because of its sparse vegetation and the possibility of finding water in the underground streams in the dry rivers. Wildebeest, zebra and buffalo migration can be viewed around the shrinking lagoons. Overnight: Heaven Nature campsite, outside Tarangire National Park

Tarangire - Serengeti National Park, Tanzania: Tarangire - Serengeti National Park (B/L/D) Today your journey leads inside Serengeti National Park - one of the most famous National Parks in Africa.This park holds truly amazing wildlife spectacles - the great migration of wildebeest and zebra. Serengeti is also home to lionds, cheetahs, leopards and many other predators. Overnight: Serengeti National Park at Pimbi Campsite.

Serengeti National Park, Tanzania: Serengeti National Park (B/L/D) Today will be the "Serengeti game viewing day". After breakfast this morning, enjoy an amazing game drive. The great diversity of Serengeti wildlife is evident here—look for buffalo, hippopotamus, elephant, giraffe, antelope, Thompson’s and Grant’s gazelle, and lions. If you are there during the spectacular wildebeest migration, you will be more than astonished. In the late afternoon we venture out in another game drive. Everywhere there are animals, monkeys and, yes, birds…but look closely and you will be thrilled to see the huge jungle cats—lion, leopard and cheetah—watching the world go by. And go by it does. Rhino, gazelle, antelope and massive elephants by the hundreds. Animals in the trees, flying, camouflaged in the bush, in rivers and in streams. This is the adventure of a lifetime! Overnight stay in Serengeti National Park at Pimbi Campsite

Serengeti - Ngorongoro Crater, Tanzania: Serengeti - Ngorongoro Crater (B/L/D) A lovely drive takes us to Ngorongoro Crater, where the lodge sits dramatically on the rim of the crater, revealing an awesome panorama of the world’s largest, unflooded and unbroken caldera. Be prepared for some remarkable views down into the crater. The caldera of Ngorongoro marks the ancient walls of a collapsed volcano, which was probably once the size of Mt. Kilimanjaro. Nowadays, the completely enclosed circular crater is some twelve miles across, with steep walls of over 2,000 feet. We are at an altitude of approximately 7,500 feet above sea level, the highest point on our trip. After our time on the lower plains, the cooler air here is refreshing. During the afternoon, enjoy a short nature walk to learn more about the local fauna, or just stay at the lodge/camp to admire the view. Overnight stay on the rim of Ngorongoro Crater at Simba Campsite

Ngorongoro Crater - Tarangire National Park, Tanzania: Ngorongoro Crater & Tarangire National Park (B/L/D) Early this morning we descend 2,000 feet to the crater floor to explore this natural zoological park, and observe an extraordinary variety of wildlife: elephant, rhinoceros, lion, hyena, zebra, wildebeest, Thomson's gazelle, reedbuck, and buffalo. The lovely crested crane (similar to a peacock) can be found in great profusion here and maybe you'll spot a bat-eared fox. The balance of predator and prey in this extraordinary ecosystem is so precise that animals seldom leave. Our exact route is decided on the spot by our expert safari guides, depending on where the animals are. An insider's tip: bring plenty of film-you may never take better wildlife photos anywhere else. Ngorongoro Crater is said to be one of the natural wonders of the world. A spectacular game haunt, the 102-square-mile crater is a perfect caldera, one of the largest on earth. Millions of years ago a smouldering volcano collapsed, creating the crater and as a consequence, thousands of animals amidst its many types of vegetation have grown here over the centuries. Over 30,000 animals live here: prides of lion, elephant, leopard, cheetah, giraffe, gazelle by the thousands, and multitudes of wildebeest. Uniquely beautiful, we will never see anything like it again! We spend a memorable morning exploring the crater's breadth and depth and returning to the lodge/camp for a late lunch. Enjoy the afternoon at leisure. The views from our lodge/camp are outstanding and there are various outlooks from which you can survey the crater. Tonight, as we delight in another delicious meal at this exceptional lodge/camp, we are once again stunned by the beauty of the orange sunset that hovers in the wild African sky, signalling the end to another unforgettable day on safari. Overnight: Heaven Nature Campsite outside Tarangire National Park

Tarangire National Park - Lake Manyara - Arusha, Tanzania: Ngorongoro Crater - Lake Manyara - Arusha (B) Leave Tarangire NP after breakfast and return to Arusha with a stop at Lake Manyara to marvel at its flocks of pink flamingos. This will have been one exciting adventure!

tourName: Tanzania camping safari, Selous and Ruaha
placesVisited: Selous Game Reserve, Rufiji River boat cruise, Lake Tagalala, Walking safari, Mikumi National Park, Ruaha National Park, Dar Es Salaam, Optional: beach extension
generalInfo:
Away from the masses, this is a great 'bush camping' adventure exploring the stunning Selous, Ruaha & Mikumi game reserves in Southern Tanzania.
The itinerary gives you the opportunity to view a myriad of African animals on your own personal safari away from the masses of tour buses.

Highlights
• Visit the Selous & Ruaha Parks
• Game viewing on the Rufiji River
• Ruaha National Park
• A connoisseur’s safari
• Camping in the ‘bush’

Selous Game Reserve, Africa’s largest protected area uninhabited by man, offers the lucky few visitors an experience in absolutely wild and unspoiled bush. The park varies from rolling grassy plains to open woodlands and rocky outcrops cut by the Rufiji River – the lifeblood of the park, whose tributaries form a network of lakes, lagoons and channels that offer a superb method of game viewing especially during the dry season (from June to October). Selous hosts Tanzania’s greatest population of elephants as well as being one of the few areas you can see African wild dogs. You will also get the opportunity to explore Ruaha National Park which derives its name from the Great Ruaha River that flows through the Rift Valley on the eastern part of the Park creating spectacular gorges. Finally visiting Mikumi National park, the 4th largest in Tanzania and a great spot for big game viewing as well as bird watching.
Exploring on foot, by boat and by 4WD and sleeping in tents you will get a true appreciation of the best Southern Tanzania has to offer.

Selous Game Reserve
Selous Game Reserve, Africa’s largest protected area uninhabited by man, offers the lucky few visitors an experience in absolutely wild and unspoiled bush. The park varies from rolling grassy plains to open woodlands and rocky outcrops cut by the Rufiji River – the lifeblood of the park, whose tributaries form a network of lakes, lagoons and channels that offer a superb method of game viewing especially during the dry season (from June to October). Selous hosts Tanzania’s greatest population of elephants.


Ruaha National Park
Due to its’ distance from any major city, very few tourists visit this park. Ruaha National Park has a varied and fascinating terrain with wild fig trees, rare baobab forests and gorges of glowing orange sandstone. Compared with Selous, here you won’t find big grassy plains nor lakes (so you won’t be able to do safaris by boat). The Great Ruaha River contain swirling rapids and deep pools crowded by dozens of crocodiles and hippos fighting each other. Ruaha is a good place to spot predators. In fact, apart from lions, jackals and hyenas, we saw a group of wild dogs hunting.

Private Tailor made trip available from June-November and a Group Departure in October

dayInfo.description: ARRIVE AT KILIMANJARO AIRPORT On your arrival at Kilimanjaro International Airport met our transfer driver and take you to Pazuri Inn Lodge,booked on bed and breakfast,giving you a choice of eating in their excellent restaurant.

ARUSHA TO LAKE MANYARA NATIONAL PARK 07:00hrs pick up by your driver guide drive to Lake Manyara with your packed lunch,arrive for a full day game drive in Lake Manyara National Park. Here you will see thousands of flamingos and pelicans as well as numerous elephants etc. Packed lunch in the park near some hot springs,Late afternoon leave the park to Migomban Campsite for dinner and overnight.

MANYARA TO SERENGETI NATIONAL PARK After breakfast check out and drive to Central Serengeti via Ngorongoro Conservation area,proceed with afternoon game drive,Search for the 'big five' as well as the myriad smaller animals as well as Crocodiles can be found in the Grumeti River, as well as hippos which make each safari unique,Dinner and overnight at Seronera Campsite.

FULL DAYS IN CENTRAL SERENGETI Enjoy 2 full days in Central Serengeti,Serengeti is the largest and most famous park in Tanzania, known worldwide for its endless plains, wildebeest-migration, herds of lions and other predators like hyenas, cheetahs and leopards. Dinner and overnight at Seronera Campsite.

SERENGETI TO NGORONGORO CONSERVATION AREAS After breakfast check out with your belongs for another half day game drive in Serengeti National Park,enjoy your packed lunch in the park ,by 15:00hrs leave the park and drive to Ngorongoro Conservation Area,check set your tents at Simba Campsite wait for dinner and overnight.

FULL DAY CRATER TOUR This morning we are up before sunrise to visit Ngorongoro Crater with packed lunch for full day crater tour. The Crater is a perfectly intact volcanic caldera and known as the ‘Noah’s ark’ of game reserves. During our morning game drives again there is the chance to view the ‘big 5’, lion, leopard, elephant, rhino and buffalo, as well as plains game peacefully grazing including, zebra, gazelle, impala and wildebeest. Hippopotamus are found lolling in the pools and Lake Magadi can be rimmed with the pink of greater and lesser flamingo. Early evening leave the Crater and drive to Simba Campsite for dinner and overnight.

NGORONGORO TO TARANGIRE NATIONAL PARK After breakfast check out and drive to Tarangire National Park for excellent game viewing. Tarangire is a small park which offers some excellent sights. Generally in the dry seasons Tarangire comes alive as wildlife and bird life congregate on the Tarangire River, which is a permanent source of water,enjoy your packed in the park. Late afternoon drive to Kigongoni Campsite for dinner and overnight.

FULL DAY IN TARANGIRE NATIONAL PARK Enjoy a full day in Tarangire National Park,It is most famous for its elephant migration, birding and authentic safari atmosphere,packed lunch will be provided. Dinner and overnight at Kigongoni Campsite.

tourName: Tanzania cultural safari holiday
generalInfo: A high-value privately guided road safari for 2 or more clients with daily departures (subject to availability) featuring both luxury tented camps and traditional safari lodges, this new safari offers rich selection of both cultural activities and wildlife viewing experiences. The highlights include visiting the Hadzabe and Datoga Indigenous ethnic groups for a first-hand insight into the lives of people living around Lake Eyasi in the central Rift Valley, some of who still survive exclusively based on the traditional means of foraging, with relatively little modification to their way of life. Also included is a visit to a traditional Maasai Homestead in addition to a Coffee Plantation Tour and a guided tour of Mto Wa Umbu local market.

dayInfo.description: Arrive at Arusha’s Kilimanjaro International Airport and meet your customer service representative. Transfer to Arusha town situated at the foot of Mount Meru. Check in to the Four Points by Sheraton Arusha; established in 1894, the Four Points by Sheraton Arusha is one of the oldest hotels in East Africa. Saturated with the history of a bygone era, traditional ambience is effortlessly combined with the style and service you wish for when travelling. The hotel features 114 stylish rooms, free Wi-Fi, a 24-hour gym, Parachichi restaurant as well as the famous Hatari Bar offering live or DJ music on Fridays. Parachichi Restaurant, ‘avocado’ in Swahili, overlooks our beautiful garden and is the perfect place for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Afternoon will be at leisure, with lunch and dinner on own account. Overnight at Four Points by Sheraton, Traditional Room-BB

After breakfast transfer check out of the hotel and set off for safari; drive to Tarangire National Park: Tarangire National Park has an incredible diversity of landscapes and vegetation and is famous for the large number of elephants, baobabs and climbing lions. The topography of the hills covered with baobabs and anthills is divided by the river Tarangire which attracts a large number of animals migrating in the dry season. Enjoy game drives in Tarangire, with packed box lunch In the afternoon drive to Lake Manyara and check in at Manyara Escarpment Lodge: Perched high on the rim of the Great Rift Valley, Manyara Escarpment Lodge is a serene haven overlooking the wonder of Lake Manyara below. Offering 16 private, tastefully decorated chalets. Inviting the incredible beauty of the African bush in expanses of windows and doors mean that you have nature right around you as you sit in the comfort and luxury of the superbly appointed bar lounge. A spreading deck surrounding the main lodge affords you breathtaking views of the lake and the gorge upon which the lodge perches watch pelican sweep the skies as you take sundowners, see the sun slip like a segment of orange into the hills and listen to the sounds of Africa nestle up to you as night slides in. Dinner and overnight at Escarpment Luxury Lodge-Chalet-L-DBB

This morning after breakfast drive into Lake Manyara National Park for game drives for a better part of the morning; located in the northern part of Tanzania, Lake Manyara National Park is 126 kilometers west of Arusha Town. The park is sized 330 square kilometers of which 220 sq. kilometers. Lake Manyara National Park is well known for the tree climbing lions, the soda ash lake and its flamingos, we are talking about breathtaking scenery! Return to the lodge for lunch. In the afternoon visit Mto Wa Umbu township; sight see, enjoy and indulge yourself in the diverse culture of Tanzania as you take a guided walking tour through the local streets of Mto wa Mbu, returning to the lodge in the evening Dinner and overnight at Escarpment Luxury Lodge-Chalet-LDBB

Check out of the lodge and drive past Ngorongoro Conservation area, stopping en route for a visit to the world-famous Olduvai Gorge Paleolithic site and reputed Cradle of Mankind Museum’.After a visit of the site & packed lunch at OI Duvai proceed to Serengeti National Park and to and to Baobab Camp which is ideally located for safari game drives as well as optional activities such as balloon safaris Lunch and afternoon game drive. About the Serengeti: Covering 14,763 sq. km of endlessly rolling savannah plains, the Serengeti is Tanzania’s first-established, largest and most famous park wherein tens of thousands of hoofed animals roam in a constant and unremitting search for the fresh grasslands upon which their survival depends. Dinner and overnight at Baobab Camp or similar-LDBB

With a full day in Serengeti your options are wide. Breakfast, lunch and dinner are served at the camp. Game drives can be taken in the morning and afternoon: whilst the annual migration is the Serengeti’s most famous attraction, the Park is also renowned for its lion, many of which have been fitted with radio-transmitter collars so that their movements may be tracked, and additionally for its wealth of cheetah, zebra, giraffe, Thomson’s and Grant’s gazelle, eland, impala, klipspringer, hippo and warthog Meals and overnight at Baobab Camp or similar-LDBB
Enjoy another full day in Serengeti; game drives can be taken in the morning and afternoon. Meals and overnight at Baobab Camp or similar-LDBB

After a leisurely breakfast, leave the Serengeti and drive to the Ngorongoro Crater Conservation Area We visit a traditional Masai homestead to gain insight into their life and customs, before proceeding to Acacia Ngorongoro Luxury Camp Lunch at the camp and enjoy the afternoon at leisure, before evening Sundowner Experience All meals and overnight at Acacia Ngorongoro Luxury Camp or similar -LDBB

After an early breakfast at the lodge descend into the crater for a half day game drive in Ngorongoro Crater Ngorongoro Crater: Often referred to as the eighth wonder of the world’ the Ngorongoro Crater is one of Africa’s best-known wildlife arenas. A World Heritage Site, it is also one of the largest volcanic craters in the world (almost 20 kilometers wide, 610-760 meters deep and covering a total area of 264 square kilometers). An utterly unique biosphere, the Crater harbors grasslands, swamps, forests, saltpans, a fresh water lake and a glorious variety of birdlife, all enclosed within its towering walls. Due to its high concentration of wildlife, close-range viewing opportunities and striking scenery it is also Tanzania’s most visited destination Drive to Acacia Farm Lodge Karatu and check-in, just before lunch at the lodge In the afternoon take a guided Coffee Plantation Tour All meals and overnight at Acacia Farm Lodge-Karatu or similar property-LDBB

After breakfast, set off and drive to the shores of Lake Eyasi and visit the Hadzabe & Datoga indigenous ethnic group The Hadzabe & Datoga-are an indigenous ethnic group in north-central Tanzania, living around Lake Eyasi in the central Rift Valley and in the neighboring Serengeti Plateau. There are, as of 2015, between 1,200 and 1,300 Hadza people living in Tanzania, however only around 300 Hadza still survive exclusively based on the traditional means of foraging. As descendants of Tanzania's aboriginal hunter-gatherer population, they have probably occupied their current territory for thousands of years, with relatively little modification to their basic way of life until the past hundred years. Spend the remainder of the evening at leisure. All meals and overnight at Acacia Farm Lodge or similar-Karatu-LDBB

Enjoy a leisurely breakfast at the lodge We then proceed to the Manyara airstrip where we will drop off those in the group who may wish to extend their holiday to the 'Spice Island' of Zanzibar. Our journey continues to Arusha and on to Arusha Coffee Lodge for a late lunch before proceeding to Kilimanjaro Airport, carrying with you the memories of a lifetime as you embark on your flight

tourName: Tanzania culture and community holiday
generalInfo:
Imagine immersing yourself in Tanzania’s vibrant culture, stunning landscapes, and inspiring stories. This journey brings you closer to the people and places that make this East African country truly unique. Picture staying in our farm’s eco-friendly lodges or tents along the serene shores of Lake Victoria, powered entirely by renewable energy, where lush greenery and local wildlife create the perfect setting for your adventure.

This is not just about seeing Tanzania, it is about experiencing it. Spend your days engaging with local educators to understand the challenges of providing education with limited resources. Visit doctors and organisations supporting women living with HIV or addressing child labour, and experience daily life by drawing water from wells, grazing livestock, or exploring the striking rock formations in the city.

Take your adventure further with an optional Serengeti safari, where Africa’s legendary wildlife roams freely across sweeping plains. Then, escape to the peaceful Juma Island, where time slows down and there are no cars or motorbikes to interrupt the tranquillity. Explore lively local markets filled with fresh fish and colourful vegetables, soaking in the authentic rhythm of Tanzanian life.

For the ultimate ending, extend your trip to Zanzibar’s sunlit beaches or dive into the clear waters off Dar es Salaam, uncovering the treasures of Tanzania’s coastline.

No matter your dietary preferences, whether vegetarian, vegan, or other requirements, our catering ensures everyone is well looked after.

To ensure the best possible experience, day trips may be rearranged based on weather conditions.

Please note that anyone wishing to volunteer in a school must complete a DBS check before arriving in Tanzania.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Mwanza (from Dar es Salaam) Arrival at Mwanza International Airport Transfer to your hotel as well as going to a supermarket for your personal needs, welcome dinner, and orientation
Exploring the area Guided walking tour of the villages close by. Presentation of a local NGO Evening at leisure
Meeting with Local Educators and local leaders Participate in discussions on education and poverty with teachers and local leaders, visiting a school after school time.
Visit to a Women’s Health Organization Visit an NGO supporting women with HIV in Geita and learn about health challenges and initiatives aimed at improving women’s health.
Free Day for Relaxation Enjoy the day at the hotel pool or opt for a local cultural experience (making a local chair).
Juma Island Excursion. Day trip to Juma Island (no cars or motorbikes). Explore and experience traditional island life

Visit Mwanza, see how local fabrics are made (Kiting factory). In the afternoon we visit an NGO, SOMA, the founder will show you around in the factory and he will tell you his experiences as a social entrepreneur,discussing his journey in creating backpacks for schoolchildren that generate solar energy to help them do their homework and other activities at night.
Rest & Reflection Free day to relax by the pool
Experiencing Local Daily Life. Participate in activities such as fetching water from the well or herding livestock Engage with local families and learn about their routines and challenges

Visiting Mwanza town Visit the stunning rock formations around Mwanza as well as the centre. Learn about malaria in the laboratory of a private clinic and visit an NGO combat child labor. Afternoon at leisure
Visit a agricultural farm as well as an agricultural organization learning about crops and how to grow them best.

optional: Serengeti National Park. Safari to Serengeti National Park (Optional) or visiting Geita gold trade market and the forest of Geita. Optional 3-day Serengeti safari (add-on) Day 1: Game drive in Serengeti, overnight at a safari lodge Day 13: Serengeti Safari (Optional) Day 2: Full day of game drives, exploring the diverse wildlife of the Serengeti Day 14: Serengeti Safari & Return to Mwanza (Optional) Day 3: Final morning game drive, return to Mwanza in the evening
Free Day, relax at the pool.
Visit to Saanane Island. Day trip to Saanane Island National Park, a serene spot for hiking, wildlife viewing, and picnicking
Cultural Heritage Experience Visit Bujora museum and learn about local tribes and learn about Tanzania’s rich cultural heritage and traditions
Visit the local markets, fish, goat and/or vegetables. learn about keeping fish and/or goats. See the local wich doctor in the afternoon.
Clean up the environment (plastic) with your guides and show villagers the importance of this. Afternoon we will evaluate this trip and prepare your trip back home.
Going to Mwanza and fly out to Dar es Salaam to leave back home or for instance to extend your trip with a few days to Zanzibar and/or dar es Salaam.

tourName: Tanzania family camping safari
generalInfo:
Private Tailor made trip available from June-November

Away from the masses, this is a great 'bush camping' family adventure exploring the stunning Selous, Ruaha & Mikumi game reserves in Southern Tanzania.
The itinerary gives you the opportunity to view a myriad of African animals on your own personal safari away from the masses of tour buses.

Highlights
• Visit the Selous & Ruaha Parks
• Game viewing on the Rufiji River
• Ruaha National Park
• A connoisseur’s safari
• Camping in the ‘bush’

Selous Game Reserve, Africa’s largest protected area uninhabited by man, offers the lucky few visitors an experience in absolutely wild and unspoiled bush. The park varies from rolling grassy plains to open woodlands and rocky outcrops cut by the Rufiji River – the lifeblood of the park, whose tributaries form a network of lakes, lagoons and channels that offer a superb method of game viewing especially during the dry season (from June to October). Selous hosts Tanzania’s greatest population of elephants as well as being one of the few areas you can see African wild dogs. You will also get the opportunity to explore Ruaha National Park which derives its name from the Great Ruaha River that flows through the Rift Valley on the eastern part of the Park creating spectacular gorges. Finally visiting Mikumi National park, the 4th largest in Tanzania and a great spot for big game viewing as well as bird watching.
Exploring on foot, by boat and by 4WD and sleeping in tents you will get a true appreciation of the best Southern Tanzania has to offer.

Selous Game Reserve
Selous Game Reserve, Africa’s largest protected area uninhabited by man, offers the lucky few visitors an experience in absolutely wild and unspoiled bush. The park varies from rolling grassy plains to open woodlands and rocky outcrops cut by the Rufiji River – the lifeblood of the park, whose tributaries form a network of lakes, lagoons and channels that offer a superb method of game viewing especially during the dry season (from June to October). Selous hosts Tanzania’s greatest population of elephants.


Ruaha National Park
Due to its’ distance from any major city, very few tourists visit this park. Ruaha National Park has a varied and fascinating terrain with wild fig trees, rare baobab forests and gorges of glowing orange sandstone. Compared with Selous, here you won’t find big grassy plains nor lakes (so you won’t be able to do safaris by boat). The Great Ruaha River contain swirling rapids and deep pools crowded by dozens of crocodiles and hippos fighting each other. Ruaha is a good place to spot predators. In fact, apart from lions, jackals and hyenas, we saw a group of wild dogs hunting.

Private Tailor made trip available from June-November

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL (D): Arrive at the airport, then be met and driven down south to Selous Game Reserve. Depending on the time of your arrival you will settle in and later depart for evening boat cruise along Rufiji River. Return for your dinner and overnight at Selous Hippo.

CAMPING DAY AT LAKE TAGALALA (B, L, D): Adventurous camping day! Check out from the camp then drive into the middle of the reserve to set up your camp at the bank of Lake Tagalala. Later in the afternoon, drive through the reserve for sunset game drive. Our professional and experienced cook will prepare African dishes for dinner.
JOURNEY TO MOROGORO (B, L, D): An early start, break up your camp and drive to Morogoro, stopping for lunch en-route. Overnight at Morogoro Hotel

DISCOVERING RUAHA NATIONAL PARK (B, L, D): An early start from your hotel, transfer to Ruaha National Park with lunch en-route. At Ruaha you will sty at Msembe Bandas. These are basic, but clean rooms located on a bend in the Ruaha River. Giraffe and elephants frequently walk between the rooms and cheetahs have been seen on the river bed. Here you will have dinner.

EXPLORING RUAHA NATIONAL PARK (B, L, D): three full days Ruaha National Park. There will still be plenty for you to see in this large, stunning park. Look for wild dogs and leopards near the kopje or watch large herds of elephants and buffalo coming down to drink
RUAHA TO UDZUNGWA MOUNTAIN PARK (B, L, D): After breakfast drive to Udzungwa Mountain National Park, lunch as you go, dinner and over night at Hondo Forest Campsite.

WONDERFUL HIKING IN UDZUNGWA PARK (B, L, D): Breakfast then drive to Udzungwa Mountain National Park. Make final preparations for your trek into the mountains, including a visit to the park HQ to complete the formalities. The hike up to Sanje Waterfalls is relatively short (max 2hrs) but is quite steep in places. This is the park's most popular attraction, although it is unlikely that you will meet any other hikers. Once at Sanje there will be time to explore the forest and waterfalls, and even go for a swim in one of the plunge pools. There after return to the camp and spend the rest of the day here.
UDZUNGWA TO MIKUMI (B, L, D): After early breakfast, leave Udzungwa for Mikumi with packed lunch. Proceed with a game drive, dinner and overnight at Bastian campsite.

DAR ES SALAAM (B): Morning game drive, transfer to Dar and the Mediterranneo hotel for your overnight stay. ere you will stay on a bed and breakfast basis giving you the choice between the excellent restaurant and local pub for your evening meal.
DEPARTURE (B): Transfer to airport/ or why not extend your stay a few days on a beach or one of the lovely island resorts.

tourName: Tanzania family Safari
placesVisited: Arusha, Tarangire National Park, Ngorongoro Crater, Serengeti National Park
generalInfo:
Your 8 day trip starts amid the lush coffee plantations of Arusha. Enjoy a complimentary upgrade to a suite and recover from your flight. Make sure to take advantage of a plantation tour before you leave.

Your first stop on your safari tour is Tarangire National Park. Famous for its enormous herds of elephants, you will have plenty of opportunity to catch sight of these majestic creatures. Your nights will be spent high in a baobab tree canopy in a luxurious tree-house style lodge. Next stop is Ngorongoro Crater, a natural volcanic basin which is teeming with wildlife. You have your best chance of spotting the Big Five here along with countless other animals and birds.
