Finally you will head to the iconic Serengeti – the most famous of the African plains. Along the way you will stay in boutique accommodation, enjoy refreshing sundowners, visits to local markets and villages and embark on plenty of game drives.

dayInfo.description: On arrival in Arusha you will be met by your guide and taken to your hotel. Relax in your complimentary robe and slippers on your private sun terrace, take a dip or simply relax by the pool.

Before you leave the gateway to the national parks, you will have the chance to take a tour of the coffee estate and enjoy an alfresco lunch in its beautiful gardens before being flown to Tarangire National Park. The sixth largest park in the country is famous for its huge herds of elephant, tree climbing lions and majestic baobab tree. Keep your eyes peeled for zebra, wildebeest, giraffe and more on your afternoon game drive before checking into your incredible tree-house style lodge built into the canopy of the wonderful baobab trees. (B, L, D)

A packed day of activities sets out to show you the wonders of Tarangire including game drives, a game-walk, a visit to a Masai Village, a relaxing sundowner atop Sunset Hill and a night game drive. (B, L, D)

A morning game drive and picnic lunch takes you to the airstrip for your flight to Ngorongoro, one of the best places in Tanzania to see all of the Big Five. The wide crater floor at the foot of an extinct volcano consists of woodlands, lakes and open plains. Keep an eye out for the rare black rhino plus lions, elephants, hyenas, wildebeest and more. (B, L, D)
Time to explore the crater today so pack your camera for a full day of game drives and exploration, plus a picnic lunch. (B, L, D)

Spend the morning exploring the extensive grounds of your hotel with your guide because in the afternoon it is time to fly to the Serengeti. Arrive at your camp in time for a refreshing sundowner and spend the next two nights in a luxurious safari tent. (B, L, D)

You have arrived at the famous rolling plain of the Serengeti. The sparse vegetation here allows for some of the finest wildlife viewing in the world. You have a full day’s game drive to make the most of your unforgettable surroundings with a bush lunch and an evening sundowner. (B, L, D)

Enjoy a guided walk along the banks of the Grumeti River before a game-drive on your way back to the airstrip. You have a day room available back in Arusha so that you can freshen up before your onwards flight. (B)

tourName: Tanzania fly in safari and beach
generalInfo: These fly-in safari options are excellent for guests who are short of time, or perhaps wanting to enjoy multi-destinations or countries in one safari. Camps are intimate, - with focus being on service, location and experience. Depending on the time of year, you may enjoy three or more nights.  Camps are located in the heart of the migratory routes in the Serengeti, we have a range of well-priced packages for those guests who are really keen to enjoy an authentic safari under canvas in the right place, at the right time. Finish your trip with a flight down to  Zanzibar for 5 nights at a stunning beach resort on an all inclusive basis

dayInfo.description: Arrive Kilimanjaro airport, transfer on arrival to Forest Hill Lodge or similar on bed and breakfast basis

Collect and transfer to Arusha local airport for flight to Ndutu, Central or Northern Serengeti, depending on time of year. Meet at the airstrip by camp guide, and taken to the tented camp to settle in. All meals and selected drinks are included. The next three nights/four days will be spent enjoying game drives in the area. This safari is based on shared game drive activities, but it is possible to organise a private vehicle if you prefer, at an additional cost

You spend the day on morning and afternoon game drives in the Serengeti. This is an immersive, edge-of-your-seat experience, shaped by the vastness of the landscape and the sharp eye of your skilled guide. Before sunrise, the plains lie in shadow, and every rustle or distant call feels charged with possibility. When the first light stretches across the horizon, long and golden, tracks and contours emerge from the dust, hinting at the wildlife moving unseen. Lions might be lounging in the shade, elephants shifting through brush, or cheetahs crouched in the distance—but you never know which will appear next, and no two days or drives are the same. The guide’s expertise turns subtle signs—a broken twig, faint paw-prints, a bird’s sudden flight—into a roadmap of anticipation, keeping you alert to every movement. As the sun dips low, the plains ignite in amber, and sundowners in the savannah offer a chance to reflect on nature's powerful beauty. Balloon safari optional. Overnight Tented Camp on full board basis inclusive of selected drinks
Game drives (morning/afternoon). Balloon safari optional. Overnight Tented Camp on full board basis inclusive of selected drinks
Return to airstrip for flight to Zanzibar, direct or via Arusha, collect on arrival and transfer to your accommodation on the coast for 5 nights on all inclusive basis
Transfer to Zanzibar airport for departing flight

tourName: Tanzania green season safari holiday
generalInfo:
Forget just seeing Africa. Come and feel its ancient heartbeat. The Serengeti is not a park; it's a living, breathing organism of epic scale. Stand silent as a million hooves of the Great Migration thunder across endless golden plains—a primal spectacle of survival and motion found nowhere else on Earth. This is the stage for the greatest wildlife show our planet still performs.

Then, descend into Ngorongoro Crater, a lost world within a world. This UNESCO-protected Eden, a collapsed volcano cradling thousands of creatures, is Africa’s densest arena of life. Here, the Big Five roam in microcosm, a breathtaking snapshot of evolution in a self-contained paradise.

Shift your gaze upward in Tarangire National Park. Its landscape is defined by ancient, colossal baobabs—silent sentinels guarding timeless secrets. In the dry season, it becomes a theatre of giants, with massive herds of elephants converging on the life-giving Tarangire River, a scene of powerful, poignant gathering.

But this journey is more than wildlife. It’s connection. Walk in the villagel witness the real africa lifestyle,learn some kiswahili and some local language fron the natives. Share a mea (local cuisine)l and stories, gaining a profound window into a resilient culture. , join a cultural walk through a bustling market or a banana plantation, tasting local flavours and witnessing Tanzanian daily life.

This is the true call: to witness earth’s greatest spectacles and touch the enduring human spirit that tends them. It’s a pilgrimage to where life began, felt in the ground’s tremor and seen in a elder’s wise smile. Your place in the great story of our world awaits. Answer the call.

dayInfo.description: When you arrive at the Kilimanjaro International airport, you will be met by your safari driver guide who will drive you an hour to Arusha, where you will spend a peaceful night at Tumbili lodge, a well-deserved retreat after a long flight. Overnight – Tumbili Lodge (Bed & Breakfast Basis)

After your leisurely breakfast, our office representative and your safari guide will give a short orientation of the safari.Shortly after orientation starts your journey from Arusha to Tarangire National Park with a packed lunch for your first wildlife adventure. The drive to Tarangire takes about 2–2.5-hours. The park is home to a variety of wildlife and bird species; it hosts amazing elephant population density per square kilometre. Lunch in the park, after lunch spend a couple of hours driving in the park for wildlife sightings. Before dark drive to your lovely accommodation for overnight and meals. Dinner & overnight – Tarangire Safari Lodge (Full Board Basis)

Another day in wildlife paradise! Start your day with an early breakfast and then explore wildlife in the morning light of an African sunrise. The wild animals enjoy mornings and evenings due to cooler temperatures. During the afternoon it gets hot, wildlife gets less active, a typical behavior that helps them conserve their energy. You will get another chance to visit the park to see more fascinating wildlife sights. When you build up an appetite, you’ll have lunch in the park; after lunch, you’ll continue the game drive in the park for a couple of hours. Tarangire Park covers 2600 square kilometers and has one of the densest populations of elephants in the northern tourist circuit of the country. Dinner & overnight – Tarangire Safari Lodge (Full Board Basis)

After your leisurely breakfast, you’ll depart with a packed lunch and enjoy a game drive on the way to Lake Manyara Park. Along the way, you will stop at the Mto wa Mbu village, where you will spend an hour walking the village to learn of the local ways of life. After the village walk, you will continue the drive. Lake Manyara Park is smaller than the Tarangire and is quite different. Its habitat provides denser thickets since it has ground water forests like the rain forest. This kind of habitat is home to beautiful birds like Ross Turaco and Hartlaub’s Turaco, but you need to have an eagle eye to spot them. Flamingoes are abundant alongside an amazing variety of bird species. Don’t be surprised to see huge troops of baboons as the park has a large population. After lunch in the park, you will carry on with the game drive for a couple of hours. Dinner & overnight – Ang’ata Camp (Full Board basis)

Start your day with an early breakfast and leave with packed lunch for a game drive to the Ngorongoro crater. It will take about an hour to drive from the lodge to the crater floor. The area is great for its diversity of flora and fauna and is one of the few places left in the world that is home to the endangered black rhinoceros. Green season (wet season) is the best time to see the rhinoceros due to great pasture all over the park. They are more easily found than in the dry season, when good pasture is reduced. After lunch in the park, you will carry on with the game drive for a couple of hours. Dinner & overnight – Ang’ata Camp (Full Board Basis)

Your day starts after a leisurely breakfast. You will leave with a packed lunch for the Serengeti National Park. Driving across the Ngorongoro highland (not the crater) to the Serengeti Park takes 2–2.5-hours. Ndutu is an area where you will stay for two nights. This park lies between the Serengeti and the Ngorongoro Conservation Area. The vast migratory herd of wildlife settles here every year from November to late March due to greater pasture and habitat. Why is it greater pasture & habitat? Volcanic activities took place in Ngorongoro over a million years ago; the ashes were blown up to these areas and made the soil rich in essential minerals and fertility, making the pasture good and rich in protein. The habitat is an open plain, which is good for the wellbeing of wildebeests and zebra. Lunch in the park when you build up an appetite. After lunch, you will continue with a game drive for a couple of hours. Dinner & overnight – Ndutu Lodge (Full Board Basis)

Start your day early by taking a packed breakfast to explore the Southern Serengeti with the morning light, searching for the great migration. The great migration is a phenomenal sight, with a huge concentration of wildlife as far as your eyes can see. Predators venture out to look for food, as prey species are abundant almost everywhere. Breakfast in the bush when you build up an appetite. After breakfast you will continue with the game drive for a couple of hours. After lunch at the camp, take a siesta until late afternoon when the sun cools down. Leave again for the late afternoon drive for a couple of hours to enjoy the evening sightings of wildlife and sunset pictures over the Serengeti. Dinner & overnight – Ndutu Lodge

After your leisurely breakfast, drive to the Ndutu Airstrip for your flight back to Arusha. In Arusha, you will be picked up from the airport and driven to Tumbili Lodge for lunch and day use room. In the late evening, you will be transferred to Kilimanjaro International Airport for your flight home.

tourName: Tanzania highlights holiday
placesVisited: Mount Meru, Arusha, Serengeti National Park, Ngorongoro Crater Conservation Area, Tarangire National Park, Game drives and optional activities, Luxury safari camps and traditional lodges
generalInfo:
If you’re short on time but hungry for highlights then this affordable week in Tanzania allows you to really hit the ground running.

A high-value road safari featuring both luxury tented camps and traditional safari lodges, this memorable Tanzanian safari offers a sensational three-night stay in the world-famous Serengeti National Park, and a visit to the ‘eighth wonder of the world’, with 2 nights in Ngorongoro.

Tanzania is simply stunning and this week-long tour aims to encapsulate the endless opportunities to observe animals whilst staying in both luxury tented safari camps and traditional lodges.

dayInfo.description: Arrive at Arusha’s Kilimanjaro International Airport and meet your customer service representative. Transfer to Arusha town situated at the foot of Mount Meru. Check in to the Four points by Sheraton Arusha Hotel (BB), a modern hotel nestled against one of the most majestic backdrops of the picturesque Mount Meru, sister peak to Africa's highest summit, Mount Kilimanjaro. Afternoon will be at leisure. Overnight at Four points by Sheraton Arusha Hotel-BB

After breakfast transfer to Arusha Airport for a morning scheduled flight to Seronera Airstrip(quoted separately) of the Serengeti National Park , and onto Conserve Safari Serengeti Camp, which is ideally located for safari game drives as well as optional activities such as balloon safaris Pick up/met at airstrip by our driver guide and transfer to camp for check-in Lunch and afternoon game drive About the Serengeti Covering 14,763 sq. km of endlessly rolling savannah plains, the Serengeti is Tanzania’s first-established, largest and most famous park wherein tens of thousands of hoofed animals roam in a constant and unremitting search for the fresh grasslands upon which their survival depends All meals and overnight at Conserve Safari Serengeti Camp or similar property-LDBB

With a full day’s game-driving in the park, your options are wide. Breakfast, lunch and dinner are served at the camp, where guided nature walks can also be taken. Game drives can be taken morning and afternoon. Whilst the annual migration is the Serengeti’s most famous attraction, the Park is also renowned for its lion, many of which have been fitted with radio-transmitter collars so that their movements may be tracked, and additionally for its wealth of cheetah, zebra, giraffe, Thomson’s and Grant’s gazelle, eland, impala, klipspringer, hippo and warthog. All meals and overnight at Conserve Safari Serengeti Camp or similar property-LDBB

With a full day’s game-driving in the park, your options are wide. Breakfast, lunch and dinner are served at the camp, where guided nature walks can also be taken. Game drives can be taken morning and afternoon. Whilst the annual migration is the Serengeti’s most famous attraction, the Park is also renowned for its lion, many of which have been fitted with radio-transmitter collars so that their movements may be tracked, and additionally for its wealth of cheetah, zebra, giraffe, Thomson’s and Grant’s gazelle, eland, impala, klipspringer, hippo and warthog. All meals and overnight at Conserve Safari Serengeti Camp or similar property-LDBB

After a leisurely breakfast, leave the Serengeti and drive to the Ngorongoro Crater Conservation Area and descend into the crater for a day tour/crater tour Ngorongoro Crater: Often referred to as the eighth wonder of the world’ the Ngorongoro Crater is one of Africa’s best-known wildlife arenas. A World Heritage Site, it is also one of the largest volcanic craters in the world (almost 20 kilometres wide, 610-760 metres deep and covering a total area of 264 square kilometres). An utterly unique biosphere, the Crater harbours grasslands, swamps, forests, saltpans, a fresh water lake and a glorious variety of birdlife, all enclosed within its towering walls. Due to its high concentration of wildlife, close-range viewing opportunities and striking scenery it is also Tanzania’s most visited destination Packed box lunch at the crater floor before driving back to your camp in the afternoon Afterwards continue to check into Acacia Farm Lodge-Karatu for late afternoon check-in Evening at leisure unwinding at the lodge All meals and overnight at Acacia Farm Lodge-Karatu or similar-LDBB

After a leisurely breakfast at lodge we leave for a heartwarming visit to Simba Milima Primary School-our local school project., where you engage with the students, learn about their daily lives, and see how the community is working together to support education Return to Acacia Farm Lodge for lunch Afternoon Coffee Farm Tour within the property All meals and overnight at Acacia Farm Lodge-Karatu or similar-LDBB

Enjoy breakfast at the lodge, before checking out by around 08:30 Today we stop at Mto Wa Umbu for guided village tour(walking tour) For participants extend their holiday to 'The Spice Island' of Zanzibar-our guide will drop you off at Manyara airstrip for your onward flight. Our journey continues to Arusha and on to Arusha Coffee Lodge for lunch before proceeding to Kilimanjaro Airport, carrying with you the memories of a lifetime as you embark on your flight home.

tourName: Tanzania luxury family safari and beach holiday
generalInfo:
Tanzania is a land of superlatives: home to the world’s largest intact caldera, the continent’s highest mountain, and wildlife populations exceeding four million.

With so much to see and do, exploring it all can feel daunting. But with some of the region’s finest camps and lodges – and the convenience of a private jet – it suddenly becomes entirely achievable.

This luxury trip is designed to transform the safari experience from remarkable to truly unforgettable. Guests travel between Tanzania’s most luxurious lodges in comfort and style aboard an intimate, executive jet, with all flights carbon neutral. The journey takes you through elephant-rich Tarangire, a stop at the Ngorongoro Crater, and front-row access to the Serengeti’s incredible wildlife and landscapes.

Finish this amazing trip with some time relaxing on the island of Zanzibar: Activities include kayaking, diving, use of snorkelling equipment, gym and tennis.

dayInfo.description: Following breakfast, you transfer to Lake Manyara airstrip. Fly to Zanzibar and transfer to Stone town for 1 night on a bed and breakfast basis. Explore Stone Town, Zanzibar’s atmospheric historic heart, where narrow alleys reveal centuries of Swahili, Arab, Indian and European influence. Visit the former Sultan’s Palace and the Old Fort, wander through bustling markets, and admire the carved wooden doors and coral-stone buildings that define the town. A guided walking tour brings the history to life, while time at the waterfront or a visit to the Freddie Mercury Museum offers a glimpse into Stone Town’s cultural past and present.
Transfer to Zanzibar airport for onward arrangements

tourName: Tanzania luxury safari and beach holiday
placesVisited: Selous Game Reserve, Rufiji River, thatched en-suite safari tent, walking safaris and game drives, on-site swimming pool and safari activities, Indian Ocean island offshore from Dar-Es-Salaam, en-suite beach cottage, beach activities include: sailing, kayaking, snorkelling and guided nature walks
generalInfo:
Ideal as a honeymoon or special occasion trip, this itinerary puts true wilderness in perspective. Combined with an idyllic remote island beach, this is a trip for making memories.

Ruaha is the largest National Park in Tanzania – nearly 50% bigger than the Serengeti, yet with a tenth of the number of visitors. The trip brings critical tourist incomes to a little visited park – but also affords a properly wild experience. Amongst its lonely plains, sweeping sand rivers and swathes of woodland, elephants occur in large herds. There are an abundance of predators: lions, leopard, hunting dog, hyena. And great crocodiles in the Ruaha river, the Park’s lifeblood. It’s also fantastic walking and driving country for the guides, who have the freedom of these vast, diverse tracts of land.

The Selous Game Reserve is popular with wildlife connoisseurs – for its remoteness, and being situated within the largest game reserve in Africa. The Rufiji River is its life force – full of hippos and crocodiles … the eleven million acres of bush, woodland, hills and grassland a diverse eco system. To be in the Selous is to suddenly walk onto a hidden riverbank, and see the flash of a leopard leaping the rocks on the opposite bank, to watch from a treetop hide as a herd of elephant silently crosses a waterhole, and to come upon a pack of African hunting dogs alone on their kill as you round a curve in the river. A truly wild place.

In Zanzibar, explore the historical heritage in the heart of Stone Town and then enjoy the secluded powder-white sand beach and warm Indian Ocean waters of the north-west of Zanzibar. Both properties on Zanzibar allow guests to indulge in luxury spa treatments and exquisite cuisine, while embracing the simplicity and serenity of beach life. On the beach in the north east of the island, Kilindi Zanzibar comprises of a series of white-domed Pavilion guest rooms all set in 50 acres of lush tropical gardens, is a rarity in the world of luxury boutique hotels. Originally designed for Benny Andersson - one of the members of the 1970's pop group ABBA - Kilindi is a true blend of the very best of diverse cultures to be found in Tanzania and on its adjacent island of Zanzibar. In each of the Pavilion suites, white wooden-slatted shutters embrace wide-arched glassless windows each affording spectacular views over the Indian Ocean. This same openness allows the gentle ocean breeze to waft throughout each of the rooms and carry with it the delightful soundtrack of Kilindi's colourful birdlife. Any stay at Kilindi will be a delight for the senses. Activities include dolphin & snorkelling tour, sunset dhow cruise, SUPing and kayaking at Elewana Kilindi Zanzibar

dayInfo.description: Fly to Dar and on to Zanzibar for 1 night in Stone Town at Jafferhi House on a bed and breakfast basis. A building over 100 years old, Jafferji House has been past from generation to generation, finally opening its doors as a guest-house and spa. Ideally located in the heart of Stone Town, close to all the attractions the historical town has to offer, Jafferji House & Spa is a small, eccentric boutique hotel. The design of the hotel captures the heritage of an era gone by and combines this with modern-day amenities, creating comfort and personalised service with attention to every detail. The suites each have a story to tell and are wonderfully furnished with Zanzibari, Swahili, Omani and Afghani antiques and artefacts. The rooftop restaurant serves Swahili cuisine, infused with a continental twist that includes many of the spices that Zanzibar is famous for: cumin, cardamom, cinnamon, star anise, turmeric, saffron, cloves and pepper. Ocean-fresh seafood is combined with freshly available produce
Transfer to Zanzibar airport for onward flight arrangements.

tourName: Tanzania Luxury safari holiday
placesVisited: Lake Duluti, Tarangire National Park, Lake Manyara National Park, Ngorongoro Crater Conservation Area, Optional: nature and bush walks, Olduvai Gorge Palaeolithic site, Serengeti National Park, Game drives, Lodges and luxury tented camp accommodation
generalInfo:
This Tanzania luxury safari is a nine-day tailor made holiday that provides a busy but well paced introduction to this beautiful country. Using a mixture of road and air travel, you will first explore the savannah and acacia parkland of Tarangire National Park, home to huge herds of migratory animals. From here, travel to Lake Manyara and keep an eye out for its famous tree climbing lions, then head to the breath-taking Ngorongoro Crater and stay in a lodge right on the crater edge. Discover the Olduvai Gorge Palaeolithic site, nicknamed ‘the cradle of mankind’ and finally crown this exceptional holiday with two nights in the vast Serengeti.

This safari covers a good amount of ground, so that you can enjoy several of Tanzania’s best game viewing destinations in minimum time. You’ll have the services of an English speaking driver guide throughout and will stay in a mixture of lodges and luxury tented camp accommodation.

dayInfo.description: On arrival at Kilimanjaro International Airport, you will be met by your driver/guide and escorted to the charming Arusha Coffee Lodge in the outskirts of Arusha Town, Dinner own account, overnight at the lodge

After breakfast, drive to Tarangire National Park in time for lunch at Tarangire Treetops Camp Tarangire Treetops-the camp sits serenely on the border of the Tarangire National Park - Tanzania. As you arrive at the Lodge, you are immediately greeted by a blaze of color and a host of smiles all of which belong to the local Maasai tribesmen who have become part of the enchanting story that is Tarangire Treetops Centered about a Main Lodge - which itself encases a thousand-year-old baobab tree - Tarangire Treetops comprises of 20 rooms all of which are elevated above the ground affording views over the tops of surrounding marula and baobab trees. Each Treetops Room boasts one of the largest bedrooms to be found in any camp or lodge in East Africa – with a floor space of 65 square metres – and all with an exotic double shower en suite bathroom. With furnishings that create warmth and demonstrate a commitment to local craftsmanship, the ‘up-in-the-air’ experience is completed by the open-fronted room design affording views across the Tarangire plains from an expansive but private balcony. Afternoon game drive in Tarangire National Park, all meals and overnight at Tarangire Treetops Camp-LDBB Distance/drive time: 165km / 2 hours

Spend a full day on safari in Tarangire National Park with morning and afternoon game drives. Second only to the Ngorongoro Crater as a dry-season (June/July) sanctuary for vast herds of migratory creatures, the park’s wildlife tends to follow clearly defined seasonal patterns. First to move north-east, often as far as Lake Natron, are the zebras and wildebeests, which begin their trek in October. After them, trek the gazelles, buffaloes, elands, oryxes and hartebeests. Finally, the elephants move out. The Defassa waterbucks, impalas, giraffes, lesser kudus, Kirk’s dik and warthogs, meanwhile, remain resident. The return of the park’s migratory species begins in June and July; firstly, with the oryxes and elands, then the elephants; and finally, the zebras and wildebeest. Breakfast, lunch and dinner and overnight at Tarangire Treetops Camp-LDBB

After breakfast drive to Lake Manyara National Park arriving at Kilimamoja Lodge in time for lunch. Nestled on the rim of the Great African Rift Valley Manyara Kilima Moja Lodge has stunning views over Lake Manyara, Mount Meru and Mount Kilimanjaro on a clear day. The lodge is set on pristine lush green gardens and local vegetation with over 130 species of birds. All rooms have panoramic views of the surrounding area. All rooms are tastefully decorated with all the amenities one would expect in a 5-star lodge, inclusive of inside and outside shower, bath, air conditioning, fire places, Wi-Fi, mini bar, safe and private balcony After lunch, enjoy an afternoon game drive in the park. All meals and overnight at Manyara Kilima Moja Lodge-LDBB Distance/drive time: 150km / 2 hours

After breakfast, drive to the Ngorongoro Crater Conservation Area and ascend the edge of the crater, before check in at Ngorongoro Lodge Meliá Collection The Ngorongoro Conservation Area is home to an ecosystem that is unlike any other in Tanzania. Designed with the utmost respect for the environment, this lodge allows you to sleep accompanied by the sounds of nature, wake up admiring the Ngorongoro Crater, and enjoy a truly extraordinary safari experience. Ngorongoro is home to a large assortment of animals including zebra, buffalo, warthog, wildebeest, hippo and elephants; and an amazing population of predators - lions, hyenas, jackals, cheetahs and the elusive leopard. Spend the afternoon at leisure enjoying the lodge’s ammenitites or opt for one of the available optional safari activities-like Cultural activities in nearby Masai villages Due to its high concentration of wildlife, close-range viewing opportunities and striking scenery it one of Tanzania’s most visited safari destinations. All meals and overnight at Ngorongoro Lodge Meliá Collection (The Rim Room) -LDBB Distance/drive time: 66kms / 1 hour

After breakfast descend into the crater for a day tour returning to the lodge for lunch(or taking wih you packed box lunch if you prefer) Spend the remainder of the evening at leisure enjoying the lodge’s ammenitites All meals and overnight at Ngorongoro Lodge Meliá Collection (The Rim Room) -LDBB

After breakfast, drive to Olduvai Gorge, one of the world’s most important Palaeolithic sites. Arrive in the Serengeti National Park in time for lunch at the Meliá Serengeti Lodge, and then enjoy an afternoon’s game drive. Dinner and overnight at the lodge Meliá Serengeti Lodge: Located in the heart of the world-renowned Serengeti National Park and overlooking the Mbalageti River Valley Less than an hour from Seronera airport and 335 km from Arusha, with easy access to Kenya and Lake Victoria Elegant rooms and suites with a Maasai-inspired décor and terraces offering spectacular views. Magnificent facilities made from sustainable architectural materials, including a swimming pool, gym, spa, Kids&Co and a meeting room equipped with the latest technology, World-class dining experience combining a fusion of local flavors and international cuisine. Located in Serengeti National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site with 15,000km2 of pure nature and the greatest concentration of wildlife on the continent, our five-star hotel boasts phenomenal views of the Mbalageti River Valley. Explore this world-class safari destination and come face-to-face with everything from lions and leopards to cheetahs and giraffes. The soul of the wild surroundings infuses every detail of the lodge, through locally sourced materials, traditional Maasai patterns, and colors in harmony with the landscape. You’ll feel fully immersed in the exquisite setting while enjoying premium services and facilities, including a swimming pool, gym, spa and range of gourmet restaurants. Whether enjoying the flower-scented sunsets, breath-taking Serengeti vistas, or any of our first-rate amenities, you’ll feel the magic of Africa every moment of your stay. Distance/drive time: 200km / 2 ½ hours

A full day on safari in the vast and sensational Serengeti. Breakfast, lunch and dinner at Meliá Serengeti Lodge Serengeti Park Covering 14,763 sq. km of endlessly rolling savannah plains, the Serengeti is Tanzania’s first-established, largest and most famous park wherein tens of thousands of hoofed animals roam in a constant and unremitting search for the fresh grasslands upon which their survival depends. The million-plus wildebeest are the predominant herbivore and also the main prey of a huge cast of large carnivores, principally lion and hyena. Whilst the annual migration is the Serengeti’s most famous attraction, the Park is also renowned for its lion, many of which have been fitted with radio-transmitter collars so that their movements may be tracked, and additionally for its wealth of cheetah, zebra, giraffe, Thomson’s and Grant’s gazelle, eland, impala, klipspringer, hippo and warthog
After breakfast, transfer to the airstrip for your internal flight to Arusha airport (Included in the safari price). Transfer either to a city hotel or to the Kilimanjaro International Airport.

tourName: Tanzania luxury safari
placesVisited: Tarangire National Park, Bush walks, Game drives, Ngorongoro Crater, Serengeti National Park, The Big Five, Optional: visit to Kuria tribe village, extension to Zanzibar
generalInfo:
Tanzania, a land of wide-open savannahs, incredible wildlife, idyllic palm fringed islands and of course, Africa’s largest mountain, the majestic Kilimanjaro, invites you to discover the wild, romantic Africa of your dreams. This is the ‘cradle of mankind’ where you can see the oldest remains of Homo Hablis at Olduvai Gorge.

A million wildebeest, each driven by the same ancient rhythm, pound the plains of the Serengeti into Kenya’s Masai Mara performing their annual pilgrimage. Triggered by the first rains, wildebeest, zebra and gazelle undertake the long trek to find pastures new and to calve. This epic migration is best seen in the south of the Serengeti between December and April and, in the north and western corridor, from June to October.

Equally synonymous with Tanzania is the Ngorongoro Crater, the world's largest inactive, intact, and unfilled volcanic caldera. The crater, which formed when a large volcano exploded and collapsed on itself two to three million years ago, is 610 metres (2,000 feet) deep and its floor covers 260 square kilometres (100 square miles). This UNESCO World Heritage site is dotted with watering holes that shelter some 30,000 animals. A game drive in this natural amphitheatre allows a rare intimacy with the wildlife that roam this paradise.

When to go: From June to February is the best time to visit as it is dry and pleasantly warm. Rainy season is generally in April and May.

Beach extension: We can extend this holiday to include beach time in Zanzibar - please ask us for more details.

dayInfo.description: Departure: Depart your country of origin - flights can be included if required.
Arrival: On arrival at Kilimanjaro airport you will be met and transferred to your chosen hotel/lodge in Arusha. At leisure.

Tarangire National Park: Short flight to Tarangire, on arrival you are met a transferred to your lodge. Following lunch, relax and familiarise yourself with your surroundings before heading out into the bush for an afternoon game drive. Tarangire is Tanzania's third largest national park and sanctuary for an unusually large elephant population. Majestic baobab trees are an interesting feature of the park, dwarfing the animals that feed beneath them. (B,L,D)

Tarangire National Park: Early morning bush walk offering the opportunity to focus on the smaller details and ecosystem of the bush whilst at the same time, achieving the thrill of stalking larger game on foot. After lunch, relax before your afternoon game drive through the swamps in search of big game. (B,L,D)

Tarangire - Ngorongoro: After breakfast fly to Manyara where you will be met and transferred to your camp while enjoying a short game ride en-route. This afternoon, visit explore the surrounding Ngorongoro volcanic landscape. (B,L,D)

Ngorongoro Crater: After an early start, descend into the Ngorongoro Crater, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and witness a true wildlife spectacle in this unique sanctuary. Enjoy a picnic lunch before returning to our lodge to relax. (B,L,D)

Ngorongoro - Serengeti: Short flight to the world famous Serengeti, home to the great migration where over a million wildebeest, zebra and gazelles migrate across the vast plains of the Masai Mara. On arrival you will be met and transferred to your lodge with a short game drive en-route. Following lunch, relax before your afternoon game drive in search of lion and leopards. (B,L,D)

Serengeti National Park: A number of options to choose from, perhaps depart camp early with a picnic breakfast, returning in time for lunch or take breakfast at the lodge and depart after with a picnic lunch returning later in the day. Even without the migration the Serengeti’s wildlife is unparalleled. Lion are a practical certainty for the photographer, cheetah pace the plains, leopard lounge in sausage trees and spotted hyena and golden jackal can be seen trotting through the grass. In the acacia woodland, Kirk’s Dik-Dik, Oribi and Roan hide, whilst herds of elephant feed on the fringes. (B,L,D)

Northern Serengeti: Short flight to the Northern Serengeti where you are met and transferred to our camp with a short game drive en-route. After lunch, relax on your private terrace or by the pool before your afternoon game drive and the chance to see big cats, rhino and a variety of other wildlife found in the area. (B,L,D)

Serengeti National Park: You have a number of options to spend your time in the Serengeti. There are daily game excursions to witness the myriad of wildlife that call this wilderness home. You may also experience the Serengeti on foot with experienced guides leading thrilling walking tours. Or perhaps relax at the lodge getting reacquainted with a good book, sunning yourself by the pool or indulge in a spa treatment. Perhaps visit the nearby village of Meruga to learn about the Kuria tribe, their culture, traditions and way of life. (B,L,D)
Departure: Transfer back to the airport today for your departure flight. (B)

tourName: Tanzania national park holiday, off the beaten path
generalInfo: On this journey you'll visit Enduimet Wildlife Management area - the strategic location of the Enduimet area makes it the perfect place for both game driving and guided walks at the foot of Mount Kilimanjaro, whilst enjoying beautiful views of the highest free standing mountain in the world. You'll also visit Mkomazi National Park and the most remote salt lake in Tanzania, also known as the flamingoes breeding ground, Lake Natron; as well as the North Eastern Serengeti, Central Serengeti, Ngorongoro crater, Tarangire National Park and Arusha National Park.

dayInfo.description: Upon your arrival and meet and greet with your holiday representative you'll be transfered to your lodge for the overnight stay.

Today after the breakfast drive to Arusha National park for the guided walk with an armed ranger and later on proceed with the game drive. With only 137square km has more to see than many much larger national parks. Visit the great and small Momella lakes,, the forests that surround the Ngurdoto crater. the small Serengeti where you might spot the big animals like giraffes, buffaloes and some families of baboons. Return at your lodge in the evening for the overnight stay.

Today after the breakfast drive to Enduimet Wildlife Reserve (southern Amboseli) for the game drive and Ranger guided walk. With it's strategic location makes it the amazing place for the game drive and walking while enjoying photogenic view of the highest free standing mountain in the World.

Today after the breakfast headoff to Mkomazi national Park, via Kilimanjaro North scenic route,upon your arrival you'll proceed with the game drive. Return to your camp before dark for the overnight stay.

Today early in the morning start your game in this less visited park enjoy the sundown and the sunrise from the magnificent mountain views found in this park. Visit the rhinocerous and the wild dogs projects situated in the park. Return to your camp in the afternoon for the overnight stay.
Today after the breakfast drive back to Arusha via the Moshi town (stop for a barbeque if possible) and proceed to Arusha.

Today after breakfast drive to Tarangire National Park. This relative secrecy is odd because during the dry season it’s a part of the migratory movement and it’s second only to Ngorongoro Crater in concentration of wildlife. There are more than 500 species of birds in Tarangire National Park. Thousands of parched animals flock to the watering holes and thousands more makes their long way to the permanent water of the Tarangire River. Later drive to your lodge for the overnight stay.

Today after the breakfast at your lodge head off to Lake Natron arrive in afternoon and visit the Engare Sero Gorge and water falls followed by the guided walk led by the Maasai tribesman to the Lake Shore for the birds watching. Later on drive back to your lodge for the overnight stay

Today after the breakfast drive to Serengeti National park via Klens gate in the Eastern side of the Serengeti. Drive through the escarpments of the Eastern branch of the rift valley. Enjoy the scenery landscapes of the Waso and Ololosokwan arrive in Serengeti in mid day and proceed with the game drive. Serengeti is know for its largest population of the big cats and the home of the Great wildbeest Migration. Arrive at your camp before dark.

Today after breakfast drive off to Ngorongoro crater for the crater tour. With an area of 250 square km it was formed due to the collapsed of the volcanic activities it's now a self sustained ecosystems which support the largest population of animals. The scenery at the crater floor is astonishing. Later on ascend to your hotel in Karatu for your overnight stay.
Today after the breakfast you'll be transferred to Kilimanjaro airport for your International flight back home. End of your tour Asante sana and Karibu tena!

tourName: Tanzania Northern Circuit luxury safari
generalInfo:
Northern Tanzania’s wilderness goes on forever, an untamed eternity on an enormous scale. It’s home to the continent’s highest mountain, the planet’s largest intact caldera, unfathomable numbers of animals, vast golden plains, truly enormous skies. This is bowl-you-over country: big, bewitching, breath-taking at every turn.

Tanzania’s finest safari spots are clustered here, and we’ll fly you effortlessly between them, to reveal the regions full diversity, depth and drama. We’ll take you to the treetops of Tarangire, where bedrooms balance amid the baobabs and the country’s biggest concentration of elephants roams. We’ll drop you down into Ngorongoro Crater, the UNESCO-listed basin brim-full of wildlife. And we’ll sweep you straight onto the boundless Serengeti, so you’ve got
front-row seats for the wildest show on earth.

The Tanzania SkySafari has been meticulously planned to maximise your immersion in the African bush (with plenty of lovely surprises along the way). You’ll be treated like a VIP from start to finish: we’ll fast-track you through airports, drive you directly onto runways, whisk you away in our private plane, serve you champagne and nibbles … Then we’ll deliver you into the heart of the wilderness to be pampered at the finest camps and have your eyes opened by the very best guides.

Know that you’ll be treading lightly, too: we operate on a carbon negative basis, and each of our trips contributes to Land & Life, a foundation committed to a sustainable future that sees local communities benefit from tourism, safeguarding nature for the next generation.

So, fly with us for less time travelling, more time doing. No minute is wasted. Which leaves more opportunity for game drives and bike rides, for sundowners and stargazing, for campfires, bush walks, birdsong and the Big Five. For feeling Africa seep into your soul.

dayInfo.description: Arrive to Kilimanjaro International. You clear customs and immigration formalities and are met opposite the Arrivals Hall who will assist you to the transfer vehicle for your VIP transfer to the hotel. Accommodation Arusha Coffee Lodge in Plantation Suite on full board basis including all meals, bottled water, juice, local beer, house wine by the glass and non-premium spirits plus laundry.

Following your leisurely breakfast at Arusha Coffee Lodge, you participate in the Bean-to-Cup coffee estate tour where you have the opportunity to see the amount of work that goes into the production of coffee before it reaches your cup. You also visit the Shanga Workshop, a project operated by local Tanzanians who with a variety of disabilities who excel in artistic talent and create a variety of crafts. You have your pre-safari briefing and lunch at the lodge. Then transfer to nearby Arusha Airport for your flight to Kuro airstrip in the heart of Tarangire National Park. You are met by your custom safari vehicle for a shared game drive in the park as you make you way to the camp, arriving in the late afternoon. You are treated to a traditional Maasai boma dinner and overnight at the camp. Accommodation Elewana Tarangire Treetops in elevated tents on full board basis including all meals, bottled water, juice, local beer, house wine by the glass and non-premium spirits plus laundry

Following breakfast at the camp, you have a shared game drive in the park returning for lunch. You then have a shared, escorted bush walk guided by the camp’s naturalist (age restrictions may apply). Following the bush walk, you visit a Maasai village and then proceed to a viewpoint to enjoy light snacks and a selection of beverages as you watch the sun set over the African bush. You return to the camp for dinner and overnight. Accommodation Elewana Tarangire Treetops in elevated tents on full board basis including all meals, bottled water, juice, local beer, house wine by the glass and non-premium spirits plus laundry

Early breakfast and game drive enroute to Kuro airstrip. Fly by SkySafari flight to Serengeti. Transfer to the camp for lunch. In the afternoon depart on an afternoon game drive returning as the sun sets. Accommodation Elewana Serengeti Pioneer Camp / Elewana Serengeti Migration Camp ? on full board basis including all meals, bottled water, juice, local beer, house wine by the glass and nonpremium spirits plus laundry *January to May uses Elewana Serengeti Pioneer Camp. June to December uses Elewana Serengeti Migration Camp

OPTIONAL Shared Hot Air Balloon Safari Early morning shared transfer in the balloon company vehicle to the balloon staging site. You meet the pilot who provides a safety briefing while the crew inflate the hot air balloon. At sunrise, your shared hot air balloon lifts off over the African plains. At times, your pilot will ascend to a higher altitude to give you an overview of the ecosystem. Then you descend to treetop level to silently observe the wildlife from above. After about 50 minutes, you land and are met by the balloon staff to transport you to your shared bush breakfast. You then return to your camp or lodge. Please note that the cost is NOT included in the main quotation and shown separately. Game drive in Serengeti National Park with lunch in the bush. Return to the camp in the late afternoon for dinner under the stars and overnight. Accommodation Elewana Serengeti Pioneer Camp / Elewana Serengeti Migration Camp ? on full board basis including all meals, bottled water, juice, local beer, house wine by the glass and non premium spirits plus laundry *January to May uses Elewana Serengeti Pioneer Camp. June to December uses Elewana Serengeti Migration Camp.

Following an early breakfast at camp, depart on a full day game drive in Serengeti National Park with a picnic hamper served in the bush. Enjoy sundowners in the bush before returning to camp for dinner. Accommodation Elewana Serengeti Pioneer Camp / Elewana Serengeti Migration Camp ? on full board basis including all meals, bottled water, juice, local beer, house wine by the glass and nonpremium spirits plus laundry *January to May uses Elewana Serengeti Pioneer Camp. June to December uses Elewana Serengeti Migration Camp.

Enjoy breakfast and the camp and game drive enroute to the airstrip. Board the SkySafari flight to Manyara airstrip. On arrival transfer to Elewana The Manor at Ngorongoro arriving for lunch. Time at leisure with optional activities provided at the lodge before dinner and overnight at the lodge. Accommodation Elewana The Manor at Ngorongoro full board basis including all meals, bottled water, juice, local beer, house wine by the glass and non-premium spirits plus laundry (and picnic box lunch)

Following an early breakfast, you depart to Ngorongoro Conservation Area and the Ngorongoro Crater. You game drive in this paradise. With a space of only 102 square miles and a resident wildlife population of more than 30,000 mammals, there is a great chance that you might see all of the big five. A lunch box is provided at a picnic site overlooking a small lake populated with hippos. In the afternoon, you return to the rim of the crater and return to the lodge for dinner and overnight. Accommodation Elewana The Manor at Ngorongoro on full board basis including all meals, bottled water, juice, local beer, house wine by the glass and non-premium spirits plus laundry

Following breakfast, you transfer to Lake Manyara airstrip. Fly by SkySafari flight to Arusha Airport. Transfer to Arusha Coffee Lodge (lunch on own arrangements). You have use of a day room (depending on your onward flight and subject to availability). Transfer to Kilimanjaro International Airport for your departure flight (flight booked by agent or on own arrangements). End of our services.

tourName: Tanzania Nyerere safari holiday & Zanzibar
placesVisited: Dar es Salaam, Nyerere National Park, three nights on safari, Zanzibar beaches, optional trips including to Stone Town or Jozani Forest, option to include Mafia Island and Pemba Island
generalInfo:
Enjoy an off-the-beaten track safari experience in the Nyerere National Park, then explore the idyllic island of Zanzibar.

This 10-day tailor-made holiday offers an off-the-beaten track safari experience in Nyerere National Park in southern Tanzania where you can enjoy game drives with expert guides, plus bush walks and boat safaris. You can expect to see large herds of elephants, plus buffalo, giraffe, zebra, impala, eland, wildebeest, baboon, hyena, lion and leopard, as well as the endangered African wild dog.

From Nyerere, you'll fly to the exotic spice island of Zanzibar where you can relax on the palm-fringed sandy beaches, enjoy activities such as diving and snorkel on the colourful coral reefs, kite-surfing, mountain biking or hiking or join excursions to discover the mangrove forests, spice plantations and local villages, or the fascinating UNESCO World Heritage Site of Stone Town.

dayInfo.description: Arrive Dar es Salaam & Fly to Nyerere National Park - Upon arrival at Dar es Salaam Airport, you’ll be met by a representative who will transfer you to the domestic terminal, where you’ll board a scheduled light aircraft flight to an airstrip in the Nyerere National Park in southern Tanzania. At the airstrip, you’ll be met by a representative and driven to your luxury lodge or camp, where you’ll stay for the next four nights.

Explore Nyerere National park - Covering over 50,000 square kilometres, 5% of Tanzania, Nyerere is Africa’s largest game reserve and twice the size of the Serengeti, yet remains one of the country’s least visited safari destinations. The mighty Rufiji River winds through the park, creating a mosaic of lakes and deltas that attract diverse wildlife, especially during the dry season (June to November). Spot elephants, crocodiles, hippos, buffalo, giraffe, lion, leopard and the endangered African wild dog. Game drives in 4WD vehicles can venture off-road for closer wildlife encounters, and you can also explore this remote wilderness on foot or by boat.

Fly from Nyerere to Zanzibar - This morning you can enjoy one final game drive in the Nyerere before being transferred back to the airstrip for your scheduled light aircraft flight to Zanzibar. You will be met on arrival in Zanzibar and driven to your accommodation, where you will stay for the next four nights.

Explore Zanzibar - Zanzibar is ideal for unwinding after safari, with its beautiful sandy beaches, clear turquoise waters, and vibrant coral reefs. You can relax on palm-fringed shores or stay active with options like snorkelling, diving, windsurfing, sea kayaking, and sailing, sometimes spotting dolphins, turtles, or whale sharks. There are also opportunities to explore the island’s rich culture and history, including excursions to Stone Town, spice plantations, Jozani Forest, and local villages.

Depart from Zanzibar - Your Nyerere and Zanzibar holiday comes to an end. After breakfast, you’ll check out of your accommodation and be driven back to Abeid Amani Karume International Airport for your flight home.

tourName: Tanzania on a budget, 4 day tour
generalInfo: This budget safari plan is designed to maximize wildlife viewing opportunities. This tour  will take you to the best three National Parks of the Northern circuit. Tarangire National Park, Lake Manyara National Park and Ngorongoro Crater. Additional activities like cultural tour by visiting Maasai village or Biking around Lake Manyara and small town of Mto wa Mbu and finally a local lunch can be arranged during this tour.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Tanzania! Upon arrival in Tanzania you will meet your guide at Kilimanjaro International Airport who will escort you to your lodge in Arusha town for a relaxing. Arusha is the Tanzania Northern circuits tourists harbor. As locals Tanzanians, our guides know the country with unrivaled familiarity so you’ll be in good hands from the moment you land to the moment you leave. Overnight at Planet lodge on bed and breakfast.

After breakfast your driver will pick you up and drive to Tarangire National Park .This relative secrecy is odd because during the dry season it’s a part of the migratory movement. Thousands of parched animals flock to the watering holes and thousands more makes their long way to the permanent water of the Tarangire river. Overnight at Karatu, a town close to Ngorongoro on full board basis at Marera view lodge. Transit time from Tarangire to Marera view lodge 2hrs.

After an early wake up call head off to Ngorongoro crater for the crater tour with the packed breakfast. you will have early morning crater tour, it’s nice to get in the crater earlier. This must-visit destination in Africa harbors the highest concentrations of predators in the world-lions, hyenas, jackals and leopards . Overnight at Marera valley lodge. Transit time from Marera lodge to Ngorongoro crater is 1hr30.

After breakfast drive to Lake Manyara National Park. This Park is known for the tree climbing lions, drive in the deep forest where old tuskers still roam, blue monkeys swing among huge fig and tamarind trees, giant baobabs, and mahoganies, using their long tail as an extra limb. Late afternoon drive to Arusha for your flight to Zanzibar or flight back home. Transit time from Lake Manyara National Park to Kilimanjaro airport is 3hrs.

tourName: Tanzania photography safari tour
generalInfo:
Experience Africa at its best during an exclusive photo safari in Tanzania. Traverse the sweeping Serengeti plains, witnessing the mighty Great Migration in action, and Venture into the Ngorongoro Crater, a UNESCO-listed wonder brimming with diverse animal life in a dramatic natural arena. You'll photograph a wealth of wildlife - including big cats and large herds of elephants - against striking vistas.

This safari offers an incredible opportunity to immerse yourself in one of the world’s most extraordinary wildlife destinations. Whether capturing the vast elephant gatherings in Tarangire or the dynamic movement of migrating herds in the Serengeti, every moment is designed to provide exceptional photographic experiences across Tanzania’s iconic landscapes.

Our Tanzania photo safari is thoughtfully crafted to bring you to the best locations for wildlife encounters and photography. To elevate your experience, professional photographer Lucia Griggi will accompany the journey, offering expert guidance and hands-on tutoring. With a small group limited to just four participants, you'll receive personalized instruction, helping you refine your skills—no matter your level of expertise.

dayInfo.description: Arrive at Kilimanjaro International Airport and transfer to your hotel for a pre-safari briefing.
Embark on a game drive in Tarangire, known for its vast elephant herds and ancient baobabs. Enjoy a classic safari picnic before heading to Karatu, a lively town in the northern highlands.
Descend into the Ngorongoro Crater, a natural wonder teeming with wildlife. After an unforgettable game drive, continue to the Serengeti for an evening safari.
Spend four days photographing the Serengeti’s diverse landscapes and iconic wildlife, including lions, cheetahs, and the Great Migration. Enjoy full-day game drives with expert photography guidance.
Start with a sunrise game drive before flying from Seronera Airstrip to Kilimanjaro International Airport for your onward journey.

tourName: Tanzania safari and Great Migration holiday
generalInfo:
This safari visits Tarangire, Ngorongoro and Serengeti – with four nights in the Serengeti, and a one way scenic flight back to Arusha.

This is a great safari, staying at eco-friendly camps - the Serengeti Wilderness Camps - which have only ten tents, and are located in pristine areas of the Serengeti/Ndutu eco-system. The safari package rate includes all game drives, all meals, drinks when staying at Serengeti Wilderness Camps (house wine, beers, soft drinks and mineral water) and water on the safari vehicle. A balloon flight is optional.

When booking a TANZANIA ESSENCE scheduled departure safari, the camp guests will stay in depends on the time of year of travel to make the most of the migration. During the months January-mid March, we include nights at Ndutu for the wildebeest calving in the south. Between April – June, central Serengeti is well located for the herds moving through, and July -October, we include time in the north – for anticipated river crossings through the Mara River.

It is possible to extend the trip with time on the beach on the island of Zanzibar.

dayInfo.description: Pick up from your Arusha Hotel. From Arusha, depart early and drive to Tarangire National Park. Balance of day enjoying game drives in the area, with picnic lunch included. Overnight at a tented camp, Tarangire. Dinner included. Tarangire Ndovu/Honeyguide camp or similar. (Lunch and Dinner included) Highly underrated, yet bursting with a dense wildlife population, it won’t take you long to appreciate just why we love Tarangire. During the dry season (June to September) thousands of animals including elephant, buffalo, giraffe, wildebeest, kudu, and the rarely seen oryx migrate from the dry Maasai steppe to the Tarangire River in search of water. Lion, leopard and other predators follow, so be sure to charge your camera battery and empty your memory stick as some unique moments are waiting to be captured. With impressive landscapes dominated by baobab trees, an enormous elephant population and over 550 varieties of bird, Tarangire offers secluded game viewing and loads of game – a winning combination in anyone's book!
Full day exploring Tarangire. Overnight Ndovu/Honeyguide camp or similar. (Full board)

Morning depart Tarangire. Continue to the highlands of Karatu, stopping on the way to view Manyara and the escarpment below. Crater tour this afternoon, or tomorrow morning. (One only on the itinerary) Overnight at a lodge either crater rim or Karatu. (Full board) Travellers heading for the Serengeti and Ngorongoro Crater will pass through the town of Karatu in the green hills of Tanzania’s northern highlands. Presided over by the towering Ol Deani Volcano, this small, colourful town serves as a popular overnight stop for visitors exploring the area’s many game parks. The town offers a variety of activities including browsing the bustling marketplace, sampling beer at a local brewery, visiting a traditional homestead, or taking a guided walk through the Ngorongoro Forest in search of waterfalls and caves. Whether you are looking for cultural tours, hiking and biking opportunities, a chance to enjoy an authentic rural Tanzania experience, or simply a break between safari game drives, this underrated town has plenty to offer.

An early start today, but one we’re sure you’ve been itching to tick off your African travel bucket list. Enjoy a full morning and picnic lunch in the Ngorongoro Crater, one of the natural wonders of the world. The volcanic caldera of Ngorongoro offers spectacular game viewing in the crater. We can almost guarantee you four of the Big Five will show up, as well as a rich variety of birds, all viewed against the backdrop of the thickly forested crater walls. Varied terrains and dramatic landscapes consisting of forest, grasslands and both freshwater and soda lakes make the Ngorongoro Crater a true marvel of creation. (On some Essence of Tanzania itineraries, your crater visit may take place on Day 3, in the afternoon. The timing of this activity will be confirmed by your guide when commencing this safari) From here drive to the Serengeti eco-system to overnight at Serengeti/Ndutu Wilderness camp. (Full board and drinks included)

Full day exploring the Serengeti. Overnight at a Serengeti Wilderness Camp, or similar. (Ndutu/North or Central) Balloon safari optional extra, enquire at the time of booking. (Full board and drinks included). You are in the heart of the Serengeti, home to more than three million large mammals spread over vast endless plains. It is here that we may encounter the fascinating spectacle of the annual wildebeest migration, where one and quarter million wildebeest trek in columns of up to forty kilometres long in search of grazing, drawing with them plenty predators and numerous other species of game. From January to March the herds can largely be found birthing their young in the southern area around Ndutu, before proceeding north through the centre and Western Corridor during June and July, eventually splitting to the west and north as they continue their way toward the Mara River. August to October sees dramatic river crossings which can only be considered Africa’s “greatest leap of faith”, before the herds return south in November to repeat this amazing instinctive procession all over again

A full day exploring the Serengeti. Commonly spotted wildlife include: a multitude of plains game such as buffalo, zebra, gazelles, impala, giraffe as well as lion and leopard. Visitors can look forward to bird watching, hot air ballooning, game safaris and guided bush walks. Overnight as above.
From Serengeti Central/Ndutu camp, flight back to Arusha. (Breakfast and lunch included)

tourName: Tanzania safari and Zanzibar beach holiday
placesVisited: Tanzania safari, Lake Manyara National Park, Serengeti National Park, Ngorongoro Conservation Area, Africa's 'Big Five', Zanzibar, options to dive and snorkel over coral reefs
generalInfo:
Just the thought of a Tanzania safari and beach holiday in Zanzibar is enough to get you packing your binoculars and flip-flops which is why this awesome two week break in East Africa is well-worth getting all excited about.

Get things started on a five day safari in Tanzania where you'll explore the country's northern safari park circuit including limitless wildlife drives in Lake Manyara National Park and across the Serengeti.

Ably accompanied by your private local guide this Tanzania safari is the perfect way to find out more about the environment and wildlife of East Africa. A spectacular visit to the infamous Ngorongoro Crater is just one of several magnificent highlights to experience on this Tanzania safari holiday.

Any Tanzania safari and beach holiday has to include Zanzibar and as you bid the national parks farewell you'll be whisked off to the white sand beaches and glass clear shallows of Zanzibar to rest, revive and relive those incredible safari scenes from the comfort of a gently swaying hammock.

dayInfo.description: We will meet you on arrival at Kilimanjaro (JRO) Airport, look out for your personal welcome sign, and be transferred to your accommodation for the night.

Lake Manyara to Ngorongoro Crater Rim - Leave your lodge after breakfast and drive to the stunning Lake Manyara National Park for a morning game drive. The extraordinary birdlife, burgeoning primate population and tree climbing lions are amongst the most important lures of the park. Enjoy a hot lunch before we drive on to your new lodge situated on the rim of the Ngorongoro Crater itself. The afternoon is free at your leisure: the perfect time to go for a short walk around the crater rim or simply relax and drink in the views.

Explore the Ngorongoro Crater - This morning you have an early breakfast as we then descend to the floor of the crater in the morning light before the crowds arrive. Often described as the ‘Eighth’ Wonder of the World, the Ngorongoro Crater is utterly spectacular and a natural sanctuary for over 25,000 animals, including the endangered Black Rhino.

This morning guests will drive to Serengeti National Park, making a brief stop at the Olduvai Gorge Museum. This afternoon enjoy your game drive en-route to your accommodation. We arrive in the evening in time to check in and freshen up for dinner.

Serengeti - Today have a full day exploring the incredible wildlife of Serengeti National Park with morning and afternoon game viewing drive in the park. The expert guides know the park inside out so you can simply relax, enjoy the African landscapes and the magnificence of the wildlife. If you're particularly interested in seeing the Great Migration then your exact location within the park will be determined by the time of year you are looking to travel. Our Tanzania specialists will help you to determine the best location. Regardless of the migration, the Serengeti is simply extraordinary and is a staggering park for year round wildlife viewing. Return to camp before sunset for your final night beneath the Serengeti stars.

Fly to Zanzibar - This morning you will be driven to the airstrip in the Serengeti from where you fly on a light aircraft to Kilamanjaro Airport and then onto Zanzibar. You are met on arrival in Zanzibar and driven to your beach hotel where you stay for the following 5 nights.
Today is your departure day and after breakfast we transfer you back to the airport for your return international flight to complete your journey.

tourName: Tanzania safari holiday in the Serengeti
placesVisited: Arusha, Lake Manyara National Park, Serengeti National Park, Olduvai Gorge, Ngorongoro Crater Conservation Area, Characterful lodge accommodation
generalInfo: This Tanzania safari holiday in the Serengeti is a brilliantly time-efficient way to discover the vast plains and abundant wildlife of this beautiful East African country. Travelling by road, you’ll first arrive at Lake Manyara National Park, famous for its tree climbing lions. Spend two nights here in a tented lodge with panoramic views eastwards over Lake Manyara. Next, head to the vast and breath-taking Serengeti. Millions of animals roam here and, depending on when you travel, you have the chance to witness the Great Migration of wildebeest, zebra and Thomson’s gazelle moving across the plains in search of fresh grazing. Stay in a traditional lodge here for a further two nights, before visiting the Olduvai Gorge, also known as the ‘Cradle of Mankind’, on your way to the spectacular Ngorongoro Crater Conservation Area. You’ll spend half a day touring the crater, before your final night in an atmospheric, colonial style coffee plantation farm house. Throughout, you’ll be accompanied by an English speaking driver guide.

dayInfo.description: Transfer from your Arusha area hotel (hotel costs not included) to Arusha Airport. Fly by scheduled flight to Serengeti National Park departing 0800 arriving approximately 0930. You are met by the camp’s vehicle and provided a shared game drive en route to the camp. You have lunch at the camp and a chance to enjoy some of the facilities on offer. There is a shared afternoon game drive returning for dinner and overnight. Accommodation Dunia Camp or Olakira Migration Camp* on full board basis with soft drinks, drinking water, juice, local beer, house wine & non-premium spirits plus limited laundry

You have shared morning and afternoon game drives in the camp’s vehicles using the camp as a base for meals and relaxation. Accommodation Dunia Camp or Olakira Migration Camp* on full board basis with soft drinks, drinking water, juice, local beer, house wine & non-premium spirits plus limited laundry

Transfer to the airstrip. Fly by scheduled flight to Lake Manyara airstrip departing between 1015 and 1100 arriving 1145. You are met by your exclusive safari vehicle and proceed to Ngorongoro Conservation Area arriving at the camp for late lunch. In the afternoon, you visit a Maasai village and enjoy the remarkable views of Olmoti Crater. Accommodation The Highlands on full board basis with soft drinks, drinking water, juice, local beer, house wine & non-premium spirits plus limited laundry

A highlight awaits you this morning as you depart to explore what is commonly referred to as the World’s largest wildlife zoo. After breakfast, you descend with a picnic lunch through the early morning mists and 2,000 feet into the crater. Ngorongoro Crater is the World’s largest intact volcanic caldera. Due to its size and diversity, the crater floor is comprised of several distinct areas, ranging from forest, swamps, lakes and springs, to open grassland and some sandy dunes. It’s an awesome wildlife experience. A picnic lunch is served overlooking a small lake populated with hippos. You return to your lodge in the late afternoon for dinner and overnight. Accommodation The Highlands on full board basis (with picnic lunch) with soft drinks, drinking water, juice, local beer, house wine & non-premium spirits plus limited laundry

Travel by road to Tarangire National Park arriving at the camp for late lunch. After some time to relax and enjoy the camp’s facilities, you have an afternoon game drive. You return to the camp for dinner and overnight. Accommodation Oliver’s Camp on full board basis with soft drinks, drinking water, juice, local beer, house wine & non-premium spirits plus limited laundry

Morning shared bush walk with the camp’s guide (conditions permitting). Morning and afternoon game drives using the camp as a base for meals. In the evening, there is a shared night game drive in the camp’s vehicle. Dinner and overnight. Accommodation Oliver’s Camp on full board basis with soft drinks, drinking water, juice, local beer, house wine & non-premium spirits plus limited laundry
After an early breakfast, you depart by road to Arusha where you transfer to Arusha Airport or Arusha City Centre. We can arrange extensions to Zanzibar for time on the beach if required.

tourName: Tanzania safari holiday, tailor made
generalInfo: Your unforgettable safari adventure covers multiple game drives across all four premier wildlife parks in northern Tanzania. Immerse yourself in the region’s remarkable biodiversity, from iconic Big Five species to sweeping herds of plains game. With expert guides leading the way, this journey offers a rare opportunity to experience the untamed beauty of African wildlife at its finest.

dayInfo.description: Arusha - You will be met on arrival at Kilimanjaro (JRO) airport, look out for your personal welcome sign, and transfer to Arusha for the night before setting off on your adventure.

Tarangire - Your guide will meet you after breakfast and drive you to Tarangire National Park. Tarangire is home to large herds of Elephant, sometimes up to three hundred strong, and in the dry season they can often be joined by equally impressive herds of Wildebeest and Buffalo.

Tarangire to Ngorongoro Crater - Leave your lodge after breakfast and drive to the stunning Lake Manyara National Park for a morning game drive. The extraordinary birdlife, burgeoning primate population and tree climbing lions are amongst the most important lures of the park. Enjoy lunch before we drive on to your new lodge situated in the Ngorongoro Crater Conservation area. The afternoon is free at your leisure: the perfect time to go for a short walk or simply relax and drink in the views.

Your Serengeti adventure begins with a scenic drive into the iconic plains, including a picnic lunch and game viewing along the way to your lodge, where sweeping wilderness views and an unforgettable sunset await. Over these three days, you will venture deep into the park on full-day game drives in search of the Big Five and marvel at the incredible plains game in the region. Each evening offers time to unwind at your lodge and absorb the sights and sounds of the Serengeti, as your connection to this remarkable landscape grows.
Today is your departure day and we will transfer you to the airstrip for your light aircraft flight back to Kilimanjaro (JRO) airport in good time to connect with your return international flight.

tourName: Tanzania safari, tailor made
generalInfo:
An 11 day safari to Tanzania's Northern parks of Serengeti, Ngorongoro, Tarangire as well as the Rift Valley and a chance to climb the Sacred Mountain of the Masai (Ol Doinyo Lengai), and experience real Masai culture. This safari travels into the best areas of this game-packed region, staying amongst the game with the sounds of the African bush all around as well as visiting some off the beaten track areas of Masailand, where few venture. Lake Natron is often covered with thousands of flamingos.
For those guests wishing to climb Ol Donya Lengai, an additional night will be required to the above safari itinerary.

dayInfo.description: Arrive at Arusha’s Kilimanjaro International Airport and meet your customer service representative. Transfer to Arusha town situated at the foot of Mount Meru, Overnight hotel on a bed and breakfast basis

After breakfast, pick up from Arusha Hotel at 08:00 and depart to Tarangire Park for a game drives, overnight lodge/camp Tarangire on full board basis Tarangire National Park has an incredible diversity of landscapes and vegetation and is famous for the large number of elephants, baobabs and climbing lions. The topography of the hills covered with baobabs and anthills is divided by the river Tarangire which attracts a large number of animals migrating in the dry season.
A.m. and p.m. game drives in Tarangire, or full day with picnic lunch, overnight lodge/camp Tarangire on full board basis
Set off early and drive to Lake Natron, along the Rift Valley escarpment edge. Overnight luxury tented camp on full board basis

Lake Natron day to explore the area. Walking to waterfall, Lake Natron and cultural interaction with tribes Option to climb Ol Donya Lengai - an additional night will be needed. Lake Natron, sits in an arid landscape with volcanic backdrop. A vast super salty and alkaline lake with a high mineral concentration, attracting millions of lesser flamingoes that breed on the shores.

Drive from Natron via Loliondo to Northern or Central Serengeti depending on the season. Overnight lodge or tented camp on full board basis About the Serengeti: Covering 14,763 sq. km of endlessly rolling savannah plains, the Serengeti is Tanzania’s first-established, largest and most famous park wherein tens of thousands of hoofed animals roam in a constant and unremitting search for the fresh grasslands upon which their survival depends.

A.m. and p.m. game drives in Serengeti, or full day with picnic lunch, overnight lodge/camp Serengeti on full board basis. Whilst the annual migration is the Serengeti’s most famous attraction, the Park is also renowned for its lion, many of which have been fitted with radio-transmitter collars so that their movements may be tracked, and additionally for its wealth of cheetah, zebra, giraffe, Thomson’s and Grant’s gazelle, eland, impala, klipspringer, hippo and warthog
A.m. and p.m. game drives in Serengeti, or full day with picnic lunch, overnight lodge/camp Serengeti on full board basis
A.m. and p.m. game drives in Serengeti, or full day with picnic lunch, overnight lodge/camp Serengeti on full board basis

Depart Serengeti early to Ngorongoro, overnight lodge inside Ngorongoro. Crater visit. Overnight Ngorongoro on full board basis Ngorongoro Crater: Often referred to as the eighth wonder of the world’ the Ngorongoro Crater is one of Africa’s best-known wildlife arenas. A World Heritage Site, it is also one of the largest volcanic craters in the world (almost 20 kilometers wide, 610-760 meters deep and covering a total area of 264 square kilometers). An utterly unique biosphere, the Crater harbors grasslands, swamps, forests, saltpans, a fresh water lake and a glorious variety of birdlife, all enclosed within its towering walls. Due to its high concentration of wildlife, close-range viewing opportunities and striking scenery it is also Tanzania’s most visited destination
Drive back to Arusha, end of services. Optional beach extension to Zanzibar or one of the smaller islands (additional cost)

tourName: Tanzania small group holiday, safari & Serengeti
generalInfo:
Every year the endless plains of the Serengeti play host to the Great Migration, one of nature’s most unforgettable events. Against the backdrop of some of Africa’s most spectacular landscapes, millions of wildebeest cross the savannah in search of fresh grazing, bringing in their wake an array of equally hungry predators.

Enriching the classic northern Tanzanian safari circuit, we'll combine authentic Maasai exchanges and opportunities to get out of our vehicle and closer to breathtaking nature with safari highlights such as witnessing the Great Migration. Not far from Mount Kilimanjaro, the journey begins in Arusha before making our way through Tarangire National Park and the Ngorongoro Conservation Area on to the vast plains of the famous Serengeti National Park in search of some of the rawest wildlife experiences available. Three full days in the Serengeti National Park is the climax to a journey that includes private bush breakfasts, Maasai hospitality, coffee plantations tours and rainforest hikes, while staying in a range of stylish, sustainable lodges and camps.

Far from your average safari, this is a journey for adventurers wishing to explore these iconic landscapes beyond the established safari tracks, venturing deep into the heart and soul of this wild, untamed land.

dayInfo.description: Tour starts in Arusha: The tour begins at Arumeru River Lodge, our home for the next two nights. Tucked away behind an old coffee plantation, close to the centre of Arusha, the lodge provides an ideal spot to begin our journey. Within the beautifully kept gardens you might spot monkeys, Dik Diks and many bird species, whilst the solar heated pool offers a chance to unwind from the flight.

Arusha: Rainforest Walks & Canoeing.: Occupying the eastern edge of Africa’s Great Rift Valley, our lodge lies close to the Duluti Forestry Reserve affording an ideal opportunity for two very different excursions today. This morning we have a chance to explore something of the nearby crater lake by canoe. Surrounded by dense rainforest, Lake Duluti is home to a number of bird species, as well as impressive monitor lizards often found basking along the shores of the lake. After returning to the lodge for some downtime and lunch, we head out again in the afternoon for a guided walk through the nearby rainforest.

Arusha - Tarangire National Park: Game Drives: Departing Arusha this morning we take the road southwest, towards the breathtaking setting of the Tarangire National Park. Lying between the meadows of the Maasai Steppe and the lakes of the Great Rift Valley, Tarangire is home to large herds of elephants, as well as lions, hyenas and nearly 550 species of birds.
